**What happens now?**
 This is a full-time permanent position located in Stockholm. Nasdaq offers a hybrid workplace to find a balance between working from home and collaborating in the office, therefore it's required to come into the office at least 3 days per week. If you think you would thrive in this role, then we would love to hear from you. Please submit your resume in English as soon as possible, as the selection is ongoing. A valid work permit in EU is mandatory.
   

  

**Come as You Are**
**Nasdaq is an equal opportunity employer. We positively encourage applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of age, color, disability, national origin, ancestry, race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, veteran status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable law.**

title: Senior Backend Developer
description:
**About Enity Bank Group** 




 Enity is a challenger in the Nordic mortgage market, choosing to see the potential in people. Through inclusive, yet sustainable and responsible mortgage lending, we play an important role in supporting those who are often excluded by traditional banks.
 



  





 Since 2005, we have enabled financial empowerment for our customers, providing them access to the housing market or opportunities to get back on track through remortgage as well as offering high-yield savings accounts.
 



  





 Our brand portfolio includes Bluestep Bank, Bank2, and 60plusbanken. Together they serve customers across Sweden, Norway, and Finland, joined in a dedication to make banking simple, forward-looking, and accessible for more people.
 



  





**About the role** 




 We’re looking for a senior developer with a strong backend profile to help us modernize banking technology and create seamless digital experiences for our customers. If you enjoy solving complex problems and working with modern tech stacks, this is the role for you!
 



  





**What you’ll be doing** 




 As part of our cross-functional team, you’ll design, develop, and maintain secure, scalable applications for core banking. A key part of the role is modernizing legacy systems and transitioning them into a cloud-based, microservice-oriented architecture. You’ll collaborate closely with product owners, designers, and fellow developers to continuously improve our platforms and deliver high-quality user experiences.
 



  





**Tech stack** 




 Our tech stack includes
 


* .NET Core and C# for backend development
* SQL and stored procedures for data management
* RabbitMQ, messaging patterns, and REST APIs for integration and communication
* Azure, Azure DevOps, Kubernetes, and Docker for cloud infrastructure and deployment
* Angular, TypeScript, and ASP.NET MVC/Razor for frontend and server-side rendering



  





 While the role is backend-focused, you’ll occasionally interact with the frontend and infrastructure layers.
 



  





**Who you are** 




 We’re looking for someone with extensive experience in backend development using .NET and cloud technologies, ideally 5+ years. You are passionate about clean code, scalable architecture, and robust solutions. You enjoy collaborating, sharing knowledge, and contributing to a learning culture. Staying curious and keeping up with modern development practices comes naturally to you.
 



  





**We offer** 




 We offer an inclusive and collaborative culture where innovation is truly encouraged. With a hybrid work model (three days in the office and two remote), you’ll have the flexibility to balance work and life. We also provide great opportunities for career growth, including access to training and professional development. Plus, you’ll get to work with a modern tech stack on exciting challenges in the banking industry.
 



  





**Sound interesting?** 




 We would be happy to see your application as soon as possible, as the selection is ongoing. Please note that a valid work permit for Sweden is required for this position.
 



  





**Please note that this recruitment is managed by our external partner Safemind.
 *All* 
 applications are therefore submitted via Safemind's application form.**

title: Developer - Backend, Devops
company_industry: Venture Capital and Private Equity Principals
description:
**Location:**
 Stockholm - Hybrid/on-site, not fully remote.
   

  

**Why VNTRS?**
 By joining VNTRS, you'll be part of an environment that values innovation, partnership, and shared success. We offer significant growth opportunities and the chance to be at the forefront of technological advancements in a collaborative and dynamic setting.
   

  

 Our mission is to transform innovative ideas into successful companies. Unlike typical consultants, we are hands-on partners sharing both risks and successes with our clients. With a dedicated team of over 40 experts in Stockholm, Tallinn, and Helsinki, we are looking to expand our technical prowess by adding a skilled ML Backend developer to spearhead our development projects and contribute to our technological strategy.
   

  

**About the Role:**
 We are looking for a senior Backend developer with experience/interest in Machine learning and DevOps practices.
   

  

 As our Backend Developer, you'll play a crucial role in guiding our organization through the fast-changing AI landscape. Working within our Tech Forum, you will collaborate with a dynamic group of more than 20 professionals, including full-stack developers, DevOps engineers, and architects.
   

  

**What You’ll Do:**
* Design and develop scalable backend systems (primarily in Python/Django)
* Build and maintain CI/CD pipelines and infrastructure in cloud environments (GCP, AWS, etc.)
* Lead or support early-stage product development and architecture decisions
* Collaborate closely with product owners, designers, and fellow developers
* Represent VNTRS as a consultant on external projects with larger enterprises
* Explore and integrate ML/AI solutions when appropriate, with support from our ML specialists
* Share knowledge and contribute to internal tech discussions, tools, and standards
* Work closely with the Head of Tech to align AI initiatives with company objectives


**Who You Are / Preferred qualifications:**
* 5+ years of professional experience in software development, specifically backend development
* Strong DevOps experience: CI/CD, cloud infrastructure (GCP preferred), Docker, Terraform, etc.
* Solid experience with Python (especially Django)
* Comfortable working across the stack when needed
* Familiarity or interest in ML/AI. You don’t need to be an expert, but you’re not afraid of the buzzwords
* Excellent communicator and problem solver
* Experience working as a consultant or with different projects/products
* Fluent in Swedish and English
* Comfortable in dynamic environments and working closely with clients


**Nice to Have:**
* Experience with ML pipelines, MLOps tools, or vector databases
* Experience in startups, venture studios, or fast-paced product environments
* Familiarity with frontend frameworks (React, Next.js)


**Application:**
 If you're ready to play a key role in VNTRS's tech revolution, we want to hear from you. Apply now to contribute to the future success of VNTRS and our clients.

title: Gameplay Programmer
description:
Are you passionate about strategy games? Do you have a solid C++ background? Paradox Development Studio is offering an exciting opportunity for a Gameplay Programmer to join our dedicated team working on our latest grand strategy project, Victoria 3.
   

  

 At Paradox, we are a vibrant mix of game developers and publishers, known worldwide for our strategy games. We're passionate about our gamers, with an active player base of over five million each month across the globe. We bring our games to life, creating immersive experiences for our ever-growing community.
   

  

 We invite you to contribute to Victoria 3, a game that simulates a transformative century, starting from 1836. Your input will directly impact the game mechanics and systems, bringing to life our representation of global population dynamics, industrial revolution, and diplomatic endeavors on a grand scale.
   

  

**The Skills We’re Looking For**
* Proficiency in C++, with the ability to develop and maintain well-engineered code, focusing on stability and performance.
* Demonstrated problem-solving abilities, with the aptitude to take full ownership of features from understanding the design to implementing the code.
* Fluent in English, both written and spoken, to effectively collaborate in our international team.
* Strong communication and teamwork skills, capable of contributing positively to team dynamics and achieving project goals.


 Working at Paradox means being part of a team that values creativity and quality, where you can make a difference and shape the world of strategy gaming. We embrace our nerdy culture, regularly interact with our fans through forums and events, and end each Friday with a social hour to unwind and connect.
   

  

 If you're ready to take ownership of your work and grow as a game developer, we'd love to hear from you. Apply now and embark on an exciting journey with Paradox and the Victoria team!
   

  

 Today, Paradox consists of both publishing and internal game development. We have a broad portfolio of games and own the most important brands, including Stellaris, Europa Universalis, Hearts of Iron, Crusader Kings, Cities: Skylines, Prison Architect, Victoria, Age of Wonders and the World of Darkness catalog of brands.
   

  

 Since 2004, the company has published its games all over the world, initially through physical distribution but primarily in digital channels after 2006. Paradox games are developed primarily for PC and console platforms, but the company also releases games on mobile. The largest markets today include the US, UK, China, Germany, France and Scandinavia. In total, Paradox games have over five million players each month.

title: Senior .NET Developer
description:
*Global migration is a 21st-century reality. Whether people are fleeing from something or racing towards better opportunity, following love or seeking new experiences, more and more are living in different environments and in new ways. We celebrate the power of people coming together. That’s why we connect ambitious people abroad with their families and friends back home so they can support each other emotionally and financially, and lead more enriched lives.*
**Why Rebtel?**
 At Rebtel, we build complex, high-performing applications that power global communication. Our backend development is structured yet flexible—an environment where agility, creativity, and technical excellence are not just encouraged but expected. We maintain an agile workflow, prioritize clean, maintainable code through regular refactoring, and champion knowledge-sharing through code reviews. If you're looking for challenging problems that will stretch your skills and ignite your creativity, you’ll feel right at home.
   

  

**About You**
 As a Senior .NET Developer who not only loves solving complex problems but is passionate about code quality, and building scalable and testable solutions.
   

  

 You’ll be adequately self going, contribute to technical discussions, and aspire to deliver clean, robust code. You have a sharp eye for simplicity amidst complexity and pride yourself on thorough, thoughtful development—including writing tests for critical components. Whether working closely within your team or leading a project area independently, you’re confident, collaborative, and proactive.
   

  

**Requirements**
* Expertise in .NET Core, .NET Framework, and related technologies (e.g., ASP.NET)
* Strong knowledge of both SQL (MSSQL) and document-oriented databases like MongoDB
* Hands-on experience with DevOps practices and deployment tools (Git, Azure DevOps)
* Practical knowledge of containerization using Kubernetes
* Experience integrating with GraphQL and REST APIs
* Excellent communication skills in English
* We don’t evaluate skills by number, however we believe ideally you should have worked at least 7+ years to gain the right seniority
* Passionate about writing clean, structured, and testable code
* Puts really high weight on test coverage of their code
* Elevates the performance and mindset of the team around them
* Naturally curious, loves experimenting with new technologies
* Strategic vision for product and codebase growth


**Our Offer To You**
**Benefits**
 At Rebtel, you are the most important asset and we strive to provide a comprehensive package of benefits and perks that enhance your well-being and work experience. Here are some of the things you can expect from us:
   

  

* Pension Plan
* Health Checkups and Private Medical Insurance
* 10k Bucket (net) for wellness allowance and Travel (benefit taxed)
* Discount on gym memberships
* Bonus program
* Parental pay
* 30 days annual vacation
* Relocation Support, if you're joining us from afar, we'll assist you in making a smooth transition.


 Rebtel is an international workplace, and at the office, we speak English; therefore, high English proficiency is required.
   

  

*We are Rebtel. We come from all around the world to create products for anyone who has crossed a border. We believe in equal opportunity and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.*
 Global migration is a 21st-century reality. Whether people are fleeing from something or racing towards better opportunity, following love or seeking new experiences, more and more are living in different environments and in new ways. We celebrate the power of people coming together. That’s why we connect ambitious people abroad with their families and friends back home so they can support each other emotionally and financially, and lead more enriched lives.
   

  

 Our ambitious team reflects our international audience. We are a diverse group of people from all over the world that come together every day—and we’re looking for others driven by the same desire to create meaningful products that bridge cultural and geographic distances.

title: C++ Developer
description:
We believe that you are dreaming of using your skills in C++ and your innovative mindset to create a better democratic world. Especially by solving crimes, gathering intelligence, investigating fraud and fighting corruption. At MSAB we make that dream come true!
   

  

 MSAB is one of the world’s leading digital forensic companies. We develop digital forensic solutions for mobile device examination and analysis used globally. Working with programming you will perform demanding tasks that tickles your innovative mindset and challenge your technical skills to find your way forward towards a solution.
   

  

 If you are inspired by extracting and decrypting data, writing decoders and implementations, decoding apps, analyzing data structure and making them readable. Then you are interesting to us.
   

  

 If you also are capable in writing efficient code, embedded programming, have knowledge in Android and iOS operating systems and have skills in reverse engineering or perhaps cryptology. Then we want to know more about you.
   

  

 This is a chance to work in a company culture described as friendly, we listen to new ideas and help each other. You will have freedom to find your way forward and benefit from your innovative thinking. If this is a match and you also are inspired by being pushed beyond your comfort zone. Then we want to talk with you.
   

  

 There is so much to talk about like values, plans forward, benefits, ways of working and technology for example. But we save that for the interview.
   

  

 Send your application now!
   

  

 For more information about MSAB: https://www.msab.com/
   

  

 Department Development Role C++ Developer Locations Stockholm, Sweden Remote status Hybrid

title: Utvecklare
description:
**Senior Utvecklare – Bli en del av Virki!** 




 På Virki sätter vi våra konsulter i fokus. Vi är ett konsultbolag med en stark företagskultur där vi tror på frihet, eget ansvar och ständig utveckling. Våra medarbetare är vår största tillgång, och vi strävar efter att skapa en arbetsmiljö där du kan växa både professionellt och personligen. Vi erbjuder spännande uppdrag hos våra kunder inom olika branscher, samtidigt som vi ger våra konsulter den support och frihet de behöver för att lyckas. Vi är övertygade om att det är möjligt att ha roligt på jobbet samtidigt som vi levererar högkvalitativ service och skapar värde för våra kunder.
 



  





**Om tjänsten** 




 Är du en erfaren utvecklare som är redo för nya utmaningar? Vi vill gärna ta del av din expertis, och dela med oss av vår i en stimulerande arbetsvardag. Vi söker dig som vill vara med på vår tillväxtresa inom system- och mjukvaruutveckling. Hos oss får du möjligheten att arbeta med avancerade tekniska lösningar, moderna ramverk och vara en del av att forma framtidens digitala system. Välkommen till ett företag där vi satsar på kvalitet och innovation – med människan i centrum.
 



  





**Grundläggande kvalifikationer** 




 Vi söker dig som har en gedigen bakgrund inom mjukvaruutveckling och en stark passion för att skapa hållbara och innovativa lösningar. Du är van vid att arbeta i agila projekt, är kommunikativ, lösningsorienterad och trivs i en roll där du får kombinera djup teknisk kompetens med praktiskt ingenjörsarbete.
 



  





**Kompetenskrav** 



* Flera års erfarenhet av professionell mjukvaruutveckling
* Goda kunskaper i ett eller flera moderna programmeringsspråk
* Förståelse för hela utvecklingscykeln – från design till implementation och leverans
* Vana att arbeta med databaser och integrationer
* Erfarenhet av agila arbetssätt och samarbete i tvärfunktionella team
* Mycket god kommunikationsförmåga på svenska och engelska



  





**Meriterande** 



* Erfarenhet av arbete i molnmiljöer (t.ex. AWS, Azure eller GCP)
* Kunskap om säker utveckling och hantering av känslig data
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med system i stor skala eller hög komplexitet
* Certifieringar eller annan dokumenterad vidareutbildning inom utveckling eller agila metoder



  





**Vi erbjuder:** 



* Frihet och Flexibilitet: Möjlighet att arbeta på distans eller från vårt kontor i Stockholm.
* Personlig utveckling: Stöd för att växa i din roll genom utbildningar och erfarenheter.
* Varierande projekt: Arbeta med olika kunder och teknologier.
* Konkurrenskraftig lön och förmåner.
* Arbetsmiljö: En inkluderande arbetsmiljö där vi värdesätter frihet och utveckling.



  





 Ansök idag! Låter detta som en roll för dig? Skicka in din ansökan redan idag! Har du frågor? Tveka inte att kontakta oss.
 



  





 Vi ser fram emot att välkomna dig till vårt team på Virki!

title: Staff Software Engineer
description:
At Optimizely, we're on a mission to help people unlock their digital potential. We do that by reinventing how marketing and product teams work to create and optimize digital experiences across all channels. With Optimizely One, our industry-first operating system for marketers, we offer teams flexibility and choice to build their stack their way with our fully SaaS, fully decoupled, and highly composable solution.
   

  

 We are proud to help more than 10,000 businesses, including H&M, PayPal, Zoom, and Toyota, enrich their customer lifetime value, increase revenue and grow their brands. Our innovation and excellence have earned us numerous recognitions as a leader by industry analysts such as Gartner, Forrester, and IDC, reinforcing our role as a trailblazer in MarTech.
   

  

 At our core, we believe work is about more than just numbers -- it's about the people. Our culture is dynamic and constantly evolving, shaped by every employee, their actions and their stories. With over 1500 Optimizers spread across 12 global locations, our diverse team embodies the "One Optimizely" spirit, emphasizing collaboration and continuous improvement, while fostering a culture where every voice is heard and valued.
   

  

 Join us and become part of a company that's empowering people to unlock their digital potential!
   

  

 To get a sneak peek into our culture, find us on Instagram: @optimizely
   

  

**Introduction**
 We're seeking a skilled Staff Software Engineer with leadership ambition, to join our Graph team. This role requires significant experience designing, implementing, and maintaining SaaS with high traffic load. This role also requires several years of experience working with TypeScript.
   

  

 You will own epics from initial requirements gathering (PRD) through to successful completion, collaborating with stakeholders to ensure solutions meet market needs. You will implement features by following clean code and SOLID principals. You will also focus on the request latency when implementing features, to make sure our customers applications have good performance.
   

  

**Why is this team critical to Optimizely?**
* Business Impact: Graph is the core content delivery and search service powering the SaaS version of our Content Management System (CMS). Our customers, who rely on Graph for their websites and mobile applications, demand high performance and advanced query capabilities to deliver exceptional user experiences. Graph's reliability and speed directly impact their business success.
* High Visibility & Innovation : Our roadmap prioritizes innovative content delivery and search features, placing search and AI at the forefront of our service offering. This focus differentiates us from competitors and empowers our customers to build cutting-edge web and mobile applications. You'll be instrumental in developing these differentiating features.
* Shape the Future of Digital Experiences: The team plays a critical role in shaping the future of our customers' digital presence. Your contributions will directly influence how they engage their audiences and achieve their business objectives through innovative search and content delivery experiences.


**Some technologies we work with:**
* TypeScript, JavaScript, C#
* GraphQL, REST
* Cloudflare workers, Kubernetes
* Elasticsearch / OpenSearch


**Experience required:**
* 5+ years’ experience of developing and managing services in production
* Several years experience developing with TypeScript
* Expertise with API design and development of GraphQL or RESTful web services
* Partnering closely with internal stakeholders to gain a strong understanding of business and product data needs
* You find satisfaction in being a force multiplier for your colleagues
* Bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science or engineering or related experience require


**What sets you apart:**
* Experience developing GraphQL APIs
* Experience managing Elasticsearch / OpenSearch
* Experience in Kubernetes, Docker etc. and/ or serverless cloud stacks
* Experience developing multi-tenant services
* Experience working with go-to-market teams
* Understanding the value of pair programming/TDD/Clean Code
* Exposure/Experience leveraging functional languages / paradigms


 Optimizely is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Optimizely is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

title: Senior Mobile Engineer
description:
**Job Description**
**WHAT YOU WILL DO:**
 As a Senior Software Engineer - Mobile in the organization you will be in the center of the action where both design and product meet business. You will be working closely with Product Managers, Engineering Managers, all product teams, iOS and Android community. You should have a strong technical background, a passion for developing SDKs, mobile application development, and a drive to deliver bug-free developer and user experiences as per the business requirement without compromising on the industry best coding practices. We are looking for highly skilled and experienced for the role of Senior Software Engineer - Mobile to lead the development team of our internal tools. As an Mobile Developer, you will be responsible for designing and delivering robust and scalable solutions. You will also provide technical leadership, mentorship, and guidance to junior members in the iOS and Android community.
   

  

**Team Description**
 The Experimentation and Visual Analytics team is dedicated to the creation of advanced internal tools designed for analyzing various test variations and interpreting data effectively. This team plays a pivotal role in collaborating with all product teams across H&M, ensuring that they develop and implement the most optimized solutions for launching new features. By leveraging data-driven insights, they aim to enhance the overall efficiency and effectiveness of feature releases, ultimately contributing to H&M’s commitment to innovation and excellence in customer experience.
   

  

**You will:**
* Lead the end-to-end development of complex native and multiplatform solutions, from concept to development including testing, distribution and writing documentation.
* Drive technical decision-making, provide architectural guidance, and ensure the implementation of best practices.
* Collaborate closely with iOS and Android community, cross-functional teams, including product managers, designers, and backend developers, to define requirements and translate them into technical specifications.
* Develop scalable and maintainable libraries, ensuring adherence to coding best practices, design patterns, and architectural guidelines.
* Provide technical guidance and mentor junior iOS and Android developers, reviewing their PRs and providing constructive feedback.
* Perform thorough code reviews to ensure code quality, performance, and adherence to established coding standards.
* Ensure the performance, quality, and responsiveness of UI components and iOS/Android applications through thorough testing, debugging, and optimization. Troubleshoot and resolve complex technical issues and performance bottlenecks.
* Collaborate with other teams to understand and guide developers.
* Define test plans and ensure comprehensive test coverage.
* Drive innovation by researching and implementing cutting-edge technologies.
* Stay up to date with the latest trends and advancements in mobile development, evaluate new tools and frameworks, and promote their adoption when appropriate. Also, share knowledge and best practices with the iOS and Android community.
* Participate in architectural discussions, providing insights and proposing solutions to enhance system architecture and overall product quality.
* Contribute to the continuous improvement of development processes and workflows.
* Participate in Agile/Scrum development processes, contribute to sprint planning, and provide accurate estimations for project timelines.
* Collaborate with Security and Compliance teams to ensure that mobile solutions adhere to internal policies and industry regulations.
* Contribute to CI/CD pipelines and automation strategies to improve development workflows and reduce manual efforts.


**Who You Are**
*We are looking for people with..*
* 6+ years of experience in mobile development (Android and/or iOS).
* Hands-on experience with Kotlin Multiplatform (KMP) for shared codebases
* Strong proficiency in Kotlin for Android and Multiplatform module development.
* Proficiency in Swift, Objective-C and Kotlin for iOS and Android application and SDK integration.
* Familiarity with Jetpack Compose and SwiftUI.
* Experience in building and publishing mobile SDKs/libraries for internal or external use.
* Deep understanding of platform-specific architecture and constraints (Android/iOS).
* Experience with unit testing, integration testing, and UI testing in both platforms.
* Familiarity with KMP testing strategies including using expect/actual declarations.
* Comfortable with debugging native iOS and Android issues within shared and platform-specific code.
* Experience with modular architecture, clean code principles, and design patterns like MVVM.
* Strong understanding of dependency injection, coroutines/flows, and asynchronous programming.
* Ability to collaborate closely with cross-functional teams (iOS, Android, backend, product).
* Comfortable contributing to API design, versioning, and developer experience for SDKs.
* Familiarity with tools such as GitHub Actions for CI/CD in mobile projects.
* Experience working in Agile/Scrum team, actively participating in ceremonies and contributing to continuous delivery
* Proven experience in leading cross-platform mobile teams or initiatives, especially in contexts involving KMP or shared codebases. Experience with mobile analytics tools (e.g., Firebase or similar) and feature flagging/experimentation frameworks.


**Additional Information**
**WHO WE ARE**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future. Read more about us here
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

 All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

**Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.**

title: Sr. Software Engineer
description:
****Senior Frontend Developer****
 Are you a seasoned frontend developer who loves building user-friendly, performant, and accessible web interfaces? At DeLaval, your skills won’t just improve UI quality — they’ll support real farmers around the world. Join us and contribute to DeLaval Plus, our global digital platform that helps shape the future of dairy farming.
   

  

****The Role****
 As part of our cross-functional product team, you’ll take ownership of the frontend for DeLaval Plus — from discovery and design through to development, testing, deployment, and monitoring. You’ll work closely with designers, product managers, QA engineers, and backend developers to ship features that truly matter to our customers.
   

  

 We’re looking for a frontend developer who thrives in a team environment, writes clean and maintainable code, and brings a pragmatic approach to product development. You care about performance, quality, and long-term impact, not just delivering code that works.
   

  

**Role And Responsibilities**
 You’ll be hands-on with our modern frontend stack:
   

  

* Languages & Frameworks: TypeScript, Vue, CSS, HTML
* Testing & Quality: Cypress, Jest, SonarQube
* Build Tools: Webpack, System.js
* CI/CD & Version Control: Git, GitLab Pipelines
* Monitoring & Observability: Grafana, Sentry, Loki, OpsGenie
* Cloud & APIs: AWS (S3), REST APIs
* Accessibility & i18n: WCAG standards, internationalization best practices


**What You’ll Do**
* Develop and maintain the frontend of our core product, DeLaval Plus
* Contribute to UI/UX discussions and technical architecture decisions
* Write maintainable code with good test coverage and automated tests
* Ensure accessibility and responsiveness across devices and regions
* Help monitor and troubleshoot production issues
* Collaborate with support teams and continuously improve based on feedback
* Stay up to date with modern frontend best practices — and help your teammates do the same


**Qualifications**
* You’ve got 5+ years of frontend development experience, ideally with production systems
* You’re hands-on and proactive, with a track record of owning features from concept to deployment
* You care deeply about code quality, accessibility, and performance
* You’re a great collaborator – curious, communicative, and happy to challenge ideas respectfully
* You value MVP thinking – delivering real value early without compromising on long-term quality
* You’re customer-focused – motivated by building tools that help real people in the field
* You’re comfortable working in agile product teams and speaking English professionally
* You’re open to working from our Tumba office at least 3 days a week
* Bonus: You speak Swedish and have a driver’s license – so you can visit farms and connect with our users firsthand


**Why Join DeLaval?**
 At DeLaval, your work has real purpose. You’ll contribute to sustainable food production and help farmers worldwide through technology. We offer a hybrid work model, competitive benefits, and a welcoming team committed to learning and impact.
   

  

**Additional Information**
 This is a full-time permanent position based at DeLaval’s headquarters in Tumba, south of Stockholm. We offer a hybrid workplace model, allowing flexibility to work remotely.
   

  

 Applications close on September 26. Please ensure your application is submitted before then. We do not accept applications via email, however if you have any questions regarding the role or the recruitment process don’t hesitate to contact us
   

  

**Contact**
 Hiring manager: Magnus Storbjörk, magnus.storbjork@delaval.com
   

  

 Recruiter: Agnes Edbom, agnes.edbom@delaval.com
   

  

**About DeLaval**
 Our vision is to make sustainable food production possible. As a company built on innovation, we constantly work to find ways of helping our customers, dairy farmers, do more with less by providing world-leading milking equipment and solutions. Today, DeLaval has approximately 4,500 passionate professionals operating in more than 100 markets around the world. DeLaval is part of the Tetra Laval Group. See more at corporate.delaval.com
   

  

**Ready to join the herd?**
 Apply today and help us shape the future of farming — one clean, simple line of code at a time. We’re growing our team and looking for more developers! Visit our careers page to explore all open role

title: Sr. Software Engineer
description:
**Senior Frontend Developer – Help Shape the Future of Dairy Farming at DeLaval**
 Are you a passionate frontend developer who thrives in a collaborative, cross-functional team? Do you enjoy crafting clean, accessible, and high-quality web solutions that make a real-world impact? Join us at DeLaval and be part of the team that’s driving innovation in modern dairy farming through DeLaval Plus – our digital platform that supports farmers worldwide.
   

  

**Role And Responsibilities**
 As a frontend developer at DeLaval, you’ll work closely with Product Owners, Project Managers, Scrum Masters, UX Designers, QA Engineers, and Backend Developers to evolve and enhance the DeLaval Plus website. You’ll be part of the full journey – from idea to production – ensuring every feature delivers value to our customers.
   

  

 You’ll play a key role in developing and continuously improving the frontend of DeLaval Plus, building user-friendly, high-performance interfaces that meet both business objectives and customer needs. You’ll ensure the frontend is reliable, accessible, and scalable — from implementing new features to refining existing ones — all while maintaining clean code and solid testing practices.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
* Develop and maintain the frontend of DeLaval Plus
* Collaborate daily in a cross-functional team
* Take part in design discussions, planning, development, testing, deployment, monitoring, and incident handling
* Ensure quality through automated testing, clean code, accessibility, and continuous improvement
* Work closely with customer support teams to understand and respond to real-world needs
* Continuously learn and share knowledge with the team


**Qualifications**
 We’re looking for
 **someone with at least 5 years of experience** 
 in frontend development, and who’s ready to take technical responsibility in a product-focused team.
   

  

**Tech Stack You’ll Work With**
 We’re looking for someone with hands-on experience in most (or all) of the following:
   

  

* Languages & Frameworks: TypeScript, Vue, CSS, HTML
* Testing & Quality: Cypress, Jest (unit testing), SonarQube
* Build Tools: Webpack, System.js
* Version Control & CI/CD: Git, GitLab CI/CD pipelines
* Monitoring & Observability: Grafana, Loki, Sentry, OpsGenie
* Cloud & APIs: AWS (S3), working with APIs
* Accessibility & Internationalization: WCAG, i18n

**Who You Are**
 We value people who are:
   

  

* Responsible and proactive – you take ownership and drive work forward

* Business-aware – you’re keen to learn about our company and industry to build smarter solutions and want to work at the office in Tumba at least three days a week
* Open-minded – you’re ready to challenge and be challenged in a respectful, inclusive team
* Pragmatic – you know how to deliver value early through MVPs, while still writing clean, maintainable code that scales over time


 And yes – you’re also excited about visiting farms to better understand our customers and how our products help them every day. Thus, we also hope that you have a driver's license.
   

  

****Why DeLaval?****
 At DeLaval, we combine tradition and innovation to support dairy farmers in over 100 markets. We’re a purpose-driven company where your code directly impacts animal welfare, food quality, and sustainable farming.
   

  

**Additional Information**
 This is a full-time permanent position based at DeLaval’s headquarters in Tumba, south of Stockholm. We offer a hybrid workplace model, allowing flexibility to work remotely.
   

  

 Applications close on September 26. Please ensure your application is submitted before then. We do not accept applications via email, however if you have any questions regarding the role or the recruitment process don’t hesitate to contact us. Apply today and help us shape the future of farming — one clean, simple line of code at a time. We’re growing our team and looking for more developers! Visit our careers page to explore all open roles.
   

  

**Contact**
 Hiring manager: Magnus Storbjörk, magnus.storbjork@delaval.com
   

  

 Recruiter: Agnes Edbom, agnes.edbom@delaval.com
   

  

**About DeLaval**
 Our vision is to make sustainable food production possible. As a company built on innovation, we constantly work to find ways of helping our customers, dairy farmers, do more with less by providing world-leading milking equipment and solutions. Today, DeLaval has approximately 4,500 passionate professionals operating in more than 100 markets around the world. DeLaval is part of the Tetra Laval Group. See more at corporate.delaval.com

title: Tech Internships at Powerfunds
description:
🚀 Tech Internships at Powerfunds (3-Months · UK → Sweden Launch)
 



  





**About PowerFunds** 




  






 We’re a fintech startup from the leading AI incubator in London - AI Forge Cohort 4 in 2024, (
 
 https://www.aiforge.org/)
 
 , with a working MVP in the UK and expansion into Sweden within weeks.
 




  






 Our mission is bold: to disrupt the global mutual fund industry.
 




  






 We’re offering two internship opportunities for ambitious graduates who want to learn fast and contribute directly to a high-impact product rollout.
 




  





 https://www.powerfunds.se/landing-page
 



  





 https://www.powerfunds.co.uk/
 



  






 ⸻
 





 1️⃣ 
 
**AWS Backend Developer Intern** 




**What You’ll Do** 



* Help develop and maintain our backend service running on AWS
* Work with AI-powered tools that analyze and identify the best investment funds on the market
* Get hands-on involvement across all areas of the product
* Take initiative and influence the technical direction together with the team



**Requirements** 



* Education in data science or a related field (or working towards it)
* Curiosity and eagerness to learn new technologies
* Interest in backend systems, cloud platforms, and APIs
* Problem-solving mindset and willingness to work in a fast-paced startup



 ⸻
 



 2️⃣ 
 **UX Developer Intern** 




**What You’ll Do** 



* Create a user interface that delivers a genuine “wow” experience
* Design and bring your ideas to life together with the team
* Shape the look and feel of the product from the ground up
* Help set the direction for the user experience and interaction design



**Requirements** 



* Relevant educational background in UX, design, or related field
* Passion for intuitive, clean, and user-friendly design
* Ability to turn ideas into wireframes and prototypes
* Excitement to work on a fintech app that makes investing engaging and simple



 ⸻
 



**Why Join Us** 



* Hands-on startup experience with real ownership of projects
* Mentorship from an experienced founding team
* A chance to shape a global fintech product from the ground up
* Build your portfolio and network in fintech, AI, and product development



  





 ⚠️ Note: Both roles are unpaid 3-month internships during rollout. In return, you’ll gain invaluable experience, responsibility, and a unique story to add to your career journey.
 



  





 👉 If you’re ambitious, curious, and excited to help build a disruptive global product, we’d love to hear from you. We are reviewing candidates from the UK and Sweden.

title: Developer PA Design
description:
**Join our Team**
**About this opportunity:**
 As the tech firm that created the mobile world, and with more than 54,000 patents to our name, we’ve made it our business to make a mark. When joining our team at Ericsson you are empowered to learn, lead and perform at your best, shaping the future if technology. This is the place where you’re welcomed as your own perfectly unique self and celebrated for the skills, talent and perspective you bring to the team.
   

  

 Do you have a passion in radio and RF design? Are you in?
   

  

 We are now looking for an Intermediate - or a Senior Developer Power Amplifier (PA) Design to our growing team. We are developing PAs for Ericsson future Radio Systems. We are working on all horizons: Research, pre-development, product development as well as after-market. The amplifiers covers all applicable power levels and frequencies used for mobile narrow band and broadband applications.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* You will take part in all kinds of activities that comes with the role
* You are since several years working with power amplifiers. You could e.g. discuss with a transistor vendor, a mobile infrastructure vendor, a university or a research institute.
* You are skilled in ADS and/or AWR. If you have experience in HFSS or others it´s positive.
* You are familiar with all kinds of lab equipment. If you are used to work with load-pull equipment it´s a bonus.
* You have experience of different PA modes and architectures.
* You are familiar with transistor technology and different device vendors. You might have experience with MCM or MMIC.
* You have experience in Innovation, GaN, wideband, volume production
* If might have any kind of experience with DPD or any other linearization techniques.


**The skills you bring:**
* Education: MS in electronics or engineering physics, or PhD PA related subject
* Domain experience: Minimum 5 years within PA design
* Business understanding
* Working with people and networking
* Innovating, adapting and responding to change
* Delivering results and meeting customer expectations
* Planning and Organizing


**Additional Requirements:**
 The position is based in Stockholm Sweden, so you need to relocate to Sweden and be able to mainly work from office.
   

  

 Hybrid ways of working is implemented to some extent, but the Office is our main place of work.
   

  

**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 770881

title: Software Engineer - Installation & Customer Care
description:
10% of Europe’s CO₂ emissions are caused by residential heating and energy bills are out of control. Aira is here to change that.
   

  

 With our intelligent Aira Heat Pump at the heart, we’re making the switch to clean energy-tech easier and more affordable. Helping Europe turn off gas and slashing energy costs one home at a time.
   

  

 Founded in 2022, and with 1000+ employees and counting, Aira is driving the clean energy revolution by providing homes with modern clean energy-tech solutions such as solar power, battery storage solutions and heat pumps. With a state-of-the-art production facility in Poland, an HQ in Stockholm, Sweden, and hubs across the UK, Germany, and Italy, Aira is well on track to install clean energy-tech into 5 million homes by 2034.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Software Engineer on our Installations & Customer Care team, you’ll shape how clean energy gets delivered by designing and building the digital backbone for our field workforce. This is not just about coding features — it’s about engineering systems that replace manual, fragmented workflows with scalable, data-driven solutions.
   

  

 You’ll work at the intersection of software and real-world operations, driving technical decisions that directly impact installers, technicians, and customers. From architecting services that streamline collaboration to scaling infrastructure across new regions, you’ll own discovery as much as delivery, ensuring the tools we build solve the right problems at scale.
   

  

 In this role, you will:
   

  

  

* Own end-to-end design and implementation of systems that bring structure, efficiency, and traceability to field operations
* Architect intelligent tools that replace manual paperwork and disconnected workflows with scalable digital solutions
* Build services that simplify collaboration and handovers between installers, planners, and support teams, reducing friction across the customer journey
* Leverage operational data to design platforms that surface insights, drive continuous improvement, and guide smarter decision-making at scale
* Design resilient infrastructure that empowers a traditionally non-digital workforce to rely on intuitive tools in their daily work
* Support proactive maintenance, diagnostics, and revisit scheduling to improve long-term customer outcomes
* Scale systems into new regions and markets, adapting to diverse requirements, work practices, and service models


 We’re changing how clean energy is installed and maintained — making it smarter, faster, and better for everyone involved. If you thrive on discovery, solving complex problems, and building systems that empower people in the field, this is the role for you.
   

  

**What You Bring To The Team**
* Extensive experience in product-driven software development within agile environments
* Strong knowledge of React and TypeScript
* Solid experience with Java or another object-oriented language
* Proven ability in automated testing at different levels (unit, integration, etc.)
* Ability to balance hands-on coding with architectural thinking and technical leadership


**Nice to have**
* Experience in rapid growth environments (startups, scaleups, new markets)
* Databases (DynamoDB, PostgreSQL)
* Event-driven architectures (Kafka)
* Cloud DevOps (Docker, Kubernetes, CI/CD, logging, metrics)
* gRPC and Protobuf
* Terraform
* Kanban, Scrum, or hybrid workflows
* Digitalization of manual labor / operational modernization
* Spring Boot framework experience


**What is in it for you?**
* Gain hands-on experience in a fast-growing scale-up, with a supportive and inclusive culture, and career advancement opportunities.
* Collaborate with diverse teams across international markets and launch products globally.
* Develop and grow personally and professionally in an entrepreneurial-minded environment.
* Thrive in a dynamic, solution-oriented culture, tackling challenges and driving meaningful solutions that make a positive impact on the world.
* Influence the company's success, with a visible impact on product development and market growth.
* Enjoy the flexibility of our hybrid work model and discover our brand-new office at Norra Stationsgatan 93 in Stockholm. Conveniently located near public transport, with Sankt Eriksplan and Odenplan stations just a few minutes' walk away


 At Aira, we champion the next-generation energy as well as diversity and inclusion. We firmly believe that a diverse workforce fosters innovation and creativity, enhancing our ability to serve customers and communities effectively. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives to join our team. Our commitment is to uphold equality and inclusivity, fostering a collaborative environment where everyone can thrive and contribute to a better future for our people and the planet.

title: Senior C++ Developer XRY
description:
As Senior C++ developer in our XRY team you will be a key person in our work to defend democratic values. The team makes functionality available that solves crimes, investigates fraud, gathers intelligence and fights corruption for our clients around the globe.
   

  

 You will use your skills and innovative mindset to orchestrate our digital forensic solutions into a product that makes the world a better place. Together with your colleagues you develop interfaces and maintain features and API:s for modules delivered by several development teams to make sure our product XRY retrieves forensic data fast in a secure way and in a lawful manner.
   

  

 We believe that you have the ability to make complex things less complex, and are good at moving between overall perspective and digging deep into details, for the highest quality possible. You are experienced in understanding dependencies, and used to identify effects from your own as well as your colleagues code, e.g. in code reviews.
   

  

 We think you have a well-trained eye for sustainable software architecture, analytical skills, you are methodical in your work and you enjoy sharing your knowledge. And if you aren’t afraid to ask for help when a problem is extra challenging, then we want to talk with you.
   

  

 This is a possibility to make the world safer by using your code skills and working in a company culture described as friendly and supportive. We listen to new ideas and help each other. There is much more to talk about, like values, future plans, technology etc., but we save that for the interview.
   

  

 Send your application now!
   

  

 For more information about MSAB, please visit: http://www.msab.com
   

  

 MSAB is a world leader in forensic technology for extracting and analyzing data from mobile devices. The MSAB vision is to empower every investigation with digital forensic solutions for a safer world.
   

  

 MSAB deliver high quality digital forensic solutions to extract, review, analyze and manage data and are a trusted partner to Law Enforcement, Defense Forces, Government Agencies and Forensic Laboratories in democratic countries throughout the world enabling them to investigate crime, gather intelligence, investigate fraud and fight corruption. Our values encompass being an ethics-driven company focused on innovation and results.
   

  

 Department Development Role C++ Developer Locations Stockholm, Sweden Remote status Hybrid

title: Core Network as a service Developer
description:
**Join our Team**
**About this opportunity:**
 Ericsson's 5G core business is launching an innovative and highly dynamic unit that will change how we bring 5G solutions to the market, thus changing the way 5G core is delivered globally. We aim to build and deliver Cloud Native solutions “as a Service” on Hyper Cloud Providers (HCP).
   

  

 You will have the opportunity to spearhead how the public cloud connects with core telco services and help build more elastic and fit-for-purpose capabilities, while venturing new business models. This will fundamentally change how we bring 5G services to the industry, making it more accessible, more versatile, and create new opportunities for innovation.
   

  

 We will bring the standard methodologies of the SaaS industry in the public cloud to the realization of 5G services. We are looking for individuals who want to lead change in the industry, apply the latest technologies to a domain that society relies on day in and day out.
   

  

 Come and join us and lead the industry change!
   

  

**What you will do:**
* End-to-End Development: Drive the full lifecycle of our services, from crafting highly optimized code in Go and C/C++ to building comprehensive automated tests and robust deployment scripts.
* Architectural Excellence: Actively contribute to the design and implementation of secure, scalable, and highly reliable applications and services.
* Automated Delivery: Leverage and enhance our advanced Cloud-Native CI/CD pipelines to streamline and automate the entire software delivery process, from code commit to production.
* Operational Insight: Implement robust monitoring, logging, and alerting solutions to ensure the continuous reliability, availability, and optimal performance of our critical cloud-based applications.
* Innovation & Growth: Continuously learn and apply the latest trends and emerging technologies in cloud computing, actively sharing knowledge and contributing to the continuous growth of our company's technical expertise.
* Collaborative Impact: Thrive in a Lean, Agile, and DevSecOps environment, collaborating closely with your team members to deliver exceptional value to our customers.


**The skills you bring:**
* Strong Programming Foundation: Strong proficiency in Go and C/C++, coupled with hands-on experience in Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools like Terraform.
* Cloud Native Mastery: Deep practical experience with cloud-native development principles and technologies, including Kubernetes, Docker, and microservices architecture.
* Public Cloud Expertise: Proven experience working with major public cloud platforms such as Google Cloud Platform (GCP), Amazon Web Services (AWS), or Microsoft Azure.
* Networking Acumen: A solid understanding of core network architecture, including experience with Network Function Virtualization (NFV) and Software-Defined Networking (SDN).
* Security First Mindset: Strong understanding and practical application of network security principles and best practices.
* DevOps & Automation: Hands-on experience with modern development platforms and CI/CD tooling, specifically GitHub and GitHub Actions.
* Collaborative Spirit: You thrive in a collaborative, generative team culture, actively supporting your teammates and prioritizing customer success.
* Problem Solver & Learner: A curious mind with exceptional problem-solving skills, a passion for continuous learning, and a creative approach to technical challenges.


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Stockholm or Gothenburg
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 764517

title: Senior .NET-utvecklare
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Jobbeskrivning**
 Rollen innefattar både vidareutveckling av befintliga system och utveckling av nya lösningar.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Du ska ha arbetat med .NET 8 och .NET Framework 4.8.x eller senare
* Du ska ha arbetat med programspråket C# i minst 5 år de senaste 6 åren
* Du ska ha arbetat med Entity Framework i minst 5 år de senaste 6 åren
* Du ska ha arbetat med WCF och Rest (Web API) i minst 5 år de senaste 6 åren
* Du ska ha mycket god förståelse för CSS och BootStrap
* Du ska ha erfarenhet av Razor
* Du ska ha arbetat med databasmodellering i minst 5 år de senaste 6 åren
* Du ska ha arbetat med versionshantering inom GIT
* Du ska ha etablerat bygg och deployhantering inom Azure DevOps on prem
* Du ska ha arbetat inom bank- och finanssektorn under minst 2 år sammanhängande under de senaste 4 åren
* Du ska ha mycket god kommunikativ förmåga på svenska
* Du bör ha arbetat med enhetstestning
* Du bör ha arbetat med scriptspråk (t.ex.TypeScript eller Javascript och format JSON).
* Du bör ha en akademisk examen civilingenjör, systemvetare eller motsvarande.


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 09-09-2025
   

  

**Om Deploja**
 Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.
   

  

 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Senior utvecklare till datadrivet bolag
description:
Kunden söker en erfaren utvecklare som kan ta ansvar för bolagets systemutveckling under en övergångsperiod. Rollen passar dig som vill kombinera hands-on utveckling med ansvar för kunskapsöverföring och stabil drift i en spännande AI- och dataintensiv miljö.
   

  

**Uppdragsbeskrivning / arbetsuppgifter**
* Ta över och driva vidare utvecklingen av befintliga system
* Säkerställa att systemen är stabila och i drift
* Vidareutveckling av nya features
* Förbättra och optimera LLM
* Delta i nya projekt, t.ex. utveckling av appar och AI-lösningar
* Stötta med knowledge transfer
* Ta fram och hålla en uppdaterad dokumentation


**Skallkrav**
* Minst 10 års erfarenhet av utveckling i C# .Net
* Erfarenhet av low-level programmering och C
* Bakgrund inom big data-projekt
* Pedagogisk och kommunikativ, med förmåga att bidra till kunskapsdelning


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet av arbete i olika typer av projekt och organisationer
* AI-relaterad utveckling, gärna med LLM eller närliggande teknologier
* Kan sänka kravet på antal års erfarenhet något vid särskilt relevant profil


**Personliga egenskaper**
* Självgående och ansvarstagande
* Strukturerad med förmåga att skapa ordning i komplexa miljöer
* Kommunikativ och samarbetsinriktad
* Flexibel och lösningsorienterad med förmåga att snabbt sätta sig in i nya system


**Start:** 
 Vecka 37
   

  

**Längd:** 
 6 månader
   

  

**Omfattning:** 
 100%
   

  

**Plats:** 
 Stockholm, Södermalm (på plats 5 dagar/vecka, viss flexibilitet)

description:
