title: Qlik Sense Consultant - Business Intelligence
description:
***Freelance / Part-time***

*Remote / Option to work onsite in Varberg, Sweden*  

  

We are looking for a skilled and self-driven Qlik Sense Consultant to join us on our journey toward becoming one of Europe’s strongest fashion brands. In this role, you will play a key part in strengthening our data-driven decision-making by designing and developing dashboards and business reports that bring clarity, insights, and impact to core areas of our business.


You will collaborate with teams across Sales, Purchasing, Logistics, Finance, and more—helping translate business needs into actionable data and intuitive dashboards that support smarter decisions and stronger performance.

**Your responsibilities will include:**

* Designing and developing dashboards and reports in Qlik Sense
* Translating business requirements into scalable and maintainable BI solutions
* Visualizing insights in an intuitive, user-friendly format tailored to each team
* Integrating data from multiple sources, including ERP, logistics, e-commerce, and finance systems
* Collaborating closely with cross-functional teams such as Business Control, E-com, Supply Chain, and IT
* Supporting typical reporting areas such as:
* + **Sales:** performance, margins, campaign tracking
	+ **Purchasing:** supplier analytics, forecasting, order tracking
	+ **Logistics:** lead times, stock turnover, delivery flows
	+ **Finance:** revenue/cost analysis, budget follow-up

**We believe you have:**

* Proven experience with Qlik Sense: data modeling, scripting, and visualization
* A strong understanding of business processes—ideally in retail, e-commerce, or logistics
* The ability to turn complex data into actionable and visual insights
* A good sense for UX/UI design—you create dashboards that are both functional and easy to use
* Experience working with data from multiple systems (ERP, e-com, logistics, finance)
* A structured, communicative, and proactive mindset—you make things happen

**How to apply**


We welcome your application by 30th of September. Interviews are held on a rolling basis, and the position may be filled before the deadline.

title: Industrial Designer (temporary position)
company_industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:
Born autonomous. Born electric.
   

  

 Since 2016, our technology has connected global communities with the things they need – and all without the emissions. We’re made up of experts in multiple fields and that’s how we’ve developed a new way to move goods. This is technology purpose-built for the industry. This is safer, cleaner, and more reliable movement.
   

  

 We are Einride and this is how we build a better future.
   

  

 Want to be part of transforming road freight – for good? Einride is showing the world a new way to move, based on the latest digital, electric and autonomous technologies. Through freight capacity as a service, we enable businesses around the world to accelerate towards their sustainability goals.
   

  

 Founded in 2016, Einride became the first company in the world to deploy a cab-less autonomous electric vehicle on a public road (Sweden, 2019). In 2022, we were the first to successfully operate such a vehicle on a US public road. Today our award-winning technology has been launched across 8 countries (and counting). Our clients are some of the world’s biggest shippers, including Fortune 500 companies. We are also operating Sweden’s largest truck dedicated public charging network and counting.
   

  

 Your mission when joining the design team at Einride will be to work with the Einride product ecosystem, develop and refine design concepts, with a focus on creating products and experiences that embody Einride’s vision of sustainable, future-forward freight solutions.
   

  

**You Will**
 Prepare various 2D and 3D materials like sketches, visualisations, CAD models, and customer journey maps to effectively communicate design concepts. Also, define and apply colors, materials, and finishes (CMF) that strengthen our brand and product experience, and maintain CMF and brand guidelines to ensure consistency.
   

  

* Collaboration: Working closely with engineers, suppliers, product managers, and brand designers to ensure design concepts are feasible and coherent.
* Research & Documentation: Conducting benchmark studies and research to inform design decisions, and providing detailed design documentation and specifications to development teams.
* Advocacy & Presentation: Representing the needs of the end-user throughout the design process and presenting design directions during internal and external reviews.


**We Expect You To**
 Have a couple years of professional experience from similar roles. We believe you have an excellent sense of form and a strong portfolio to showcase your design skills. You should also be an outstanding communicator and collaborator, able to thrive in a fast-paced environment where you can continuously develop meaningful ideas and create a real impact for our users.
   

  

* Education: A BA/MA in Industrial Design or an equivalent degree.
* Technical Skills: Strong proficiency in 3D & CAD tools (e.g., Rhino, Blender), rendering software (e.g., Keyshot, Blender), and the Adobe Creative Suite.
* Bonus Qualifications: It would be a plus if you have an interest in digital products, including UI/UX and graphic design, and are proficient in Figma. An understanding of manufacturing techniques and a passion for sustainability and innovative design are also highly valued.


 This is a full-time temporary contract, with an expected duration of 12 months, to cover a parental leave based in Stockholm or Gothenburg. The start date is expected to be in the beginning of October. You will be part of a truly diverse, high performing team with a common passion for sustainability and making things happen in an innovative way. We recommend that you submit your application as soon as possible since selection and interviews are held continually.
   

  

 At Einride, we are innovators, building solutions the world has never seen before – but urgently needs. That’s why we take action, and it’s why we are always eager to be challenged. We know that our best innovations come from having a diverse mix of people, including those of different experiences, career paths, and walks of life. By coming together and sharing our perspectives openly – by disagreeing, discussing, and committing – we deliver greater impact.

title: Senior User Researcher - ZEOS Design & Research (all genders)
company_industry: Technology, Information and Internet, Retail, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
****The Role & The Team****
 We are seeking a Senior Researcher for a hybrid role that combines discovery research with research operations . This is a key strategic position designed to enhance our research practices and boost our influence on product development . You will be part of the ZEOS Design & Research team .
   

  

 Currently, our Designers and Product Managers are keen to validate their ideas and gain user insights, but are hindered by limited access to the necessary tools, participants, and reusable findings . This role is crucial in eliminating these obstacles by developing scalable research systems . Initially, you will focus on building our research infrastructure, and over time, you will shift to leading and supporting discovery projects that shape our product's direction .
   

  

 You will collaborate closely with another researcher who is focused on discovery work, ensuring that together you cover both the depth and scale of research needs .
   

  

  

****What We’d Love You to Do (and Love Doing)****
* Develop and oversee a verified internal panel of participants for continuous research activities .
* Manage and enhance our research tools, such as Great Question and various survey platforms .
* Create and uphold internal systems, templates, and guides to facilitate self-service research for our teams .
* Establish efficient workflows for survey deployment, handling incentives, and screening participants .
* Plan and execute both generative and evaluative research studies in collaboration with cross-functional teams .
* Translate research findings into clear, compelling insights that inform strategic decisions and product development .


****We’d Love to Meet You If****
* You have significant experience in user research, research operations, or a similar field .
* You are adept at independently conducting user research from start to finish .
* You have a background in developing or expanding research operations, tools, or systems .
* You excel in collaborative, cross-functional team environments .
* You are skilled in using research tools like Great Question, Dovetail, Airtable, or UserTesting .
* You are a clear and persuasive communicator who can make complex insights understandable and actionable .


 If you think you have what it takes, we encourage you to apply even if you don't meet every single requirement . You may just be the right candidate for this or other roles!
   

  

  

****Our Offer****
 Zalando provides a range of benefits, here’s an overview of what you can expect . Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer .
   

  

  

* Employee shares program
* 40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Lounge by Zalando, discounts from external partners
* 2 paid volunteering days a year
* Hybrid working model with up to 60% remote per week; actual practice is up to each team to best support their collaboration
* Work from abroad for up to 30 working days a year
* 27 days of vacation a year to start for full-time employees
* Relocation assistance available (subject to prior agreement)
* Family services, including counselling and support
* Health and wellbeing options (including Wellhub, formerly Gympass)
* Mental health support and coaching available
* Drive your development through our training platform and biannual peer-to-peer review


****Inclusive by Design****
 At Zalando, our vision is to be the leading pan-European ecosystem for fashion and lifestyle e-commerce - one that is inclusive by design. We only assess candidates based on qualifications, merit, and business needs. We welcome applications from people of all gender identities, sexual orientations, personal expressions, racial identities, ethnicities, religious beliefs, and disability statuses. We only want to know why you’re great for this role, so please avoid including your picture, age, and marital status in your CV as well.
   

  

 We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Please feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support and assist you throughout the hiring process.
   

  

 do.BETTER - our diversity & inclusion strategy https //jobs.zalando.com/en/our-culture/diversity-and-inclusion

title: SEO Specialist
description:
📍Stockholm
   

  

 📆 As soon as possible
   

  

 👩🏽‍💻 Office: 3 Days a Week
   

  

 📚 Our Recruitment Process
   

  

 At Precis, we are a group of friendly experts in media buying, analytics & marketing science, creative and technology with a joint mission to help great companies thrive in the digital landscape.
   

  

 Are you curious to learn more about us? Read more about us here. For insights into what life is like at Precis and a peek at the perks of working with us, visit this page. In our Handbook, you can get a neat summary of who we are, our culture and our offices.
   

  

*We are committed to building an inclusive and fair workplace that attracts talent and advances its people, regardless of their background, experiences or perspectives. We believe that a diverse set of minds will continue to contribute to our innovative culture and our ability to reinvent ourselves constantly.*
**What You Will Be Doing**
* Independently execute and optimise SEO tactics, ensuring they are aligned with the set strategic direction.
* Handle day-to-day operational tasks, including analysis, optimisation, and reporting, to ensure high-quality execution and optimal organic performance in standard search and search generative experiences.
* Extract and analyse data to uncover trends and insights that can guide tactical decisions and continuous improvement efforts.
* Conduct in-depth SEO analysis and audits to identify opportunities for improving brand strength and performance metrics.
* Implement testing initiatives, analyse results, and make optimisation recommendations to improve organic performance.
* Provide clients with concise, actionable recommendations based on data-driven insights, guiding strategic decisions.
* Collaborate closely with other Solution Groups to action learnings into the overall success of client experience and delivery.
* Proactively contribute to the overall growth of the SEO business.


**What We Are Looking For**
* Solid understanding of the digital marketing ecosystem, with the ability to operationally navigate all three pillars of SEO (Technical, Content & Authority) as well as AI generated search.
* Comprehensive hands-on experience and knowledge in using SEO tools & platforms (e.g. Ahrefs, SEMrush, Screaming Frog, or similar) to tailor SEO strategies for brand and performance objectives.
* Technical acumen to identify, mitigate and resolve SEO-related issues, ensuring smooth execution of SEO activities.
* Strong capability to analyse performance data, identify trends, and derive actionable insights to enhance SEO efforts.
* Capability to design and implement roadmaps to achieve client goals and correlated targets, as well as showcase untapped opportunities within SEO and CRO.
* Ability to develop hypotheses and conduct tests to inform continuous improvement practices.
* Effective communication skills for engaging with clients on operational aspects and contributing to strategic conversations.
* Familiarity with data visualisation tools (e.g. LookerStudio) and ability to present insights in an engaging and understandable manner.
* In addition to specialisation in SEO, be comfortable with CRO & UX fundamentals and how these work together to impact total website performance.


**What We Offer**
*You can read our full offering in our* 
*handbook.*
* An intense learning environment where you will be able to grow and develop your skills and passions alongside some of the brightest minds in the industry.
* A culture that is built on collaboration, trust and innovation. We value having fun together - that’s why we also have regular afterworks, team events and a yearly festival.
* Transparent salary setting, you can find all our salary bands in our handbook. This role is an L2 role within the Media, Client & SEO/CRO column. Check it out!
* 30 days paid leave, flexible public holidays, parental pay, a solid pension scheme and key insurance. Our different offices also offer different perks such as massage, health care contributions, free book orders, healthy snacks & great coffee, EAP programs and your choice of PC or Mac.
* A diverse environment with a high focus on inclusion and belonging. We speak over 27 native languages around Precis and our internal inclusion score is 4.3 out of 5.


**We update all candidates on their application by email. If you don't receive an email from us, please check your spam folder.**

title: Senior Product Designer - Visa Open Banking
description:
Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.
   

  





 Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.
   

  

  

  




**Job Description**

 We are seeking a skilled and experienced Product Designer to join the Visa Open Banking team.
   

  





 The ideal candidate will have a proven track record in creating best-in-class user interfaces and experiences, ensuring that users enjoy a seamless and engaging journey throughout the entire product flow. This role demands a keen eye for detail, creativity, and a deep understanding of user-centered design principles to consistently deliver exceptional and intuitive user experiences.
   

  





 Key Responsibilities:
   

  




* Deliver outstanding user experiences to customers through initial designs and iterative updates.
* Design from concept to implementation, considering usability, accessibility, localization, scalability, and — where relevant — crafting clear, concise interface copy that’s in line with UX writing best practices.
* Conduct user research studies to gather qualitative and quantitative data (usability testing, user interviews, A/B testing, etc) to understand customer needs, validate design decisions, and refine user experience.
* Collaborate effectively with diverse teams, ensuring smooth communication and high-quality design execution.
* Ensure all deliverables align with requirements and the established design system.
* Contribute to Visa’s Global Open Banking Platform design system in partnership with designers and developers ensuring it meets scalability, efficiency, and brand alignment requirements.
* Engage in constructive design critique with designers and cross-disciplinary partners.



 This is a hybrid position. Expectation of days in the office will be confirmed by your Hiring Manager.
   

  

  

  




**Qualifications**
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Human–Computer Interaction, Interaction Design, User Experience, or a related field.
* Experience in product design for mobile and web platforms, with a portfolio demonstrating end-to-end design work.
* Proven experience collaborating with cross-functional teams and
* Fluency with design systems and technical implementations
* Ability to clearly present and explain design decisions to both technical and non-technical audiences.
* Strong prototyping skills with a focus on clear and effective visual communication.
* Experience or strong interest in UX Writing and content strategy, with the ability to create clear, concise, and user-focused interface copy.
* Excellent command of visual design, UI patterns, and user-centered design principles.
* Solid experience in user research and usability testing.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Proficiency in industry-standard design tools, particularly Figma.
* Experience in the payments or financial services industry is a plus.
* Advanced proficiency in English.


**Additional Information**

 Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

title: Senior Product Manager
company_industry: Technology, Information and Internet, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Computer and Network Security
description:
Meet
 
 Yubico
 
 : the inventor of the
 
 YubiKey
 
 ––the world's first and leading security key. Our company’s mission is to make secure login easy and available for everyone. Yubico was founded in 2007 by Stina and Jakob Ehrensvard, and recently went public on Nasdaq Stockholm Main Market: YUBICO. Our customers include Fortune 500 companies, hundreds of government agencies and millions of individuals in over 160 countries that rely on Yubico technology to secure access to computers, online services and mobile apps. We  are a global company with a strong company culture and employees located in over 14 countries. Yubico’s  headquarters are based in  Stockholm, Sweden and Santa Clara, CA.  Aligned with our mission to make the internet more secure for everyone, Yubico donates YubiKeys to organizations helping at-risk individuals through our philanthropic initiative,
 
 Secure it Forward
 
 .
 




  





**At Yubico, we offer:**




  





**Yubico Values:
 
 We work to ensure that our employees have an open space to have their voices amplified to create a workplace where everyone feels like they belong. Aligned with this, our employees have created some pretty cool Employee Resource Groups: YubiPride, YubiBIPOC, YubiSustainability and YubiWomen. Additionally, Yubico donates YubiKeys to organizations in need all over the world (you can read more about our work here).
 

  





**Social Connection:**

 Relationships and connectedness matter, and we love spending time with our team! Our virtual workspace keeps us connected day-to-day whether it's through Yubico celebrating wins or our buzzing Slack communities. We host an all-team event in a new location every year where we plan for upcoming quarters, set goals, and most importantly, host fun events to encourage team building outside of the workplace. Check out our
 

 Life at Yubico Page
 

 on LinkedIn and our awards
 

 here
 
**.**




  






 The Role:
 




  






 Yubico is looking for a Senior Product Manager to expand and maintain products within the Hardware products. You will drive and deliver the success of your products/product areas of focus and expand the use of our technology to new and innovative areas that capture the market demand. Be part of a fast-paced, high-energy team, working with customers that represent some of the most sophisticated technology buyers on the planet.
 





  




**Tasks & Responsibilities:** 
* Responsible for the production systems that are used to program, customize, and output YubiKey's and YubiHSM's at scale
* Provide data-driven insights on the specific products being managed, including sales and financial performance, year-over-year trends, pipeline, etc
* Manage the full life-cycle of a product from inception to end of life including: conception, market and requirements gathering, customer validation, creation of high-quality requirements document, management of engineering, marketing preparation, release and end-of-life processes
* Meet with customers to understand market demand and outcomes for new products
* Partner with all teams in the company, demonstrating ownership for the product area of focus, to develop and launch new products that meet company objectives and achieve a successful product
* Take responsibility for the success of all aspects of the products, or product areas, in focus
* Gain deep market and technical knowledge of the market focused on specific competitors and their offerings and strategies
* Understand the core value of both the products being managed, but also all products and services at Yubico
* Articulate the core value of the product and inspire other team members to be excited about selling and supporting the products
* Maintain the ability to have deep technical conversations about Yubico technology, but also the underlying technology platforms, etc
* Collaborate with product marketing to create or enhance product collateral, marketing messaging, blogs, and related activities
* Represent Yubico in meetings with key customers and partners to help drive our business



  




**Basic Requirements:** 
* Five (5) years’ experience in Product Management
* One or more of the following: Eight (8) years’ experience in IT or technology, Eight (8) years’ experience in security
* Experience in managing stakeholders
* Excellent written and oral business communication skills
* Ability to collaborate across geographically dispersed functions






  




  














  





 We are an equal opportunity employer, we value diversity and uphold an inclusive environment where all people feel that they are equally respected and valued. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. We'd love to learn about what you can add to our diverse team.
 



  





 Yubico does not accept agency resumes or referrals so please do not send them to our careers staff or employees. Yubico is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes or referrals.
 



  





 Personal data submitted through this form is used for managing Yubico’s recruitment activities, which include facilitating any application you make, setting up and conducting interviews and tests for applicants, evaluating and assessing results and selecting candidates, and as otherwise needed in our recruitment and onboarding processes. The use of your personal data may also be necessary prior to entering into a contract with you (that is prior to offering you a job with Yubico). Your personal data will only be used for the purposes for which it was collected and in accordance with the Yubico Privacy Notice. We only keep your personal data for as long as necessary and in compliance with Yubico’s record retention policies. If you have asked us to, we will keep you informed of other opportunities at Yubico. We do this in various ways, including email and by phone. If at any time you do not want us to contact you or use your information as described herein please contact us at jobs@yubico.com to let us know and we will delete all such information. Providing your personal data is voluntary, but necessary to join our talent community, and if you do not agree to provide your data, we will not be able to consider you as part of our talent community.
 



  





 As part of providing the requested service, we will transfer your data to be processed by Lever, Inc., a service provider contracted by Yubico AB and/or its subsidiaries that meets legally mandated privacy requirements. The Yubico Privacy Notice offers more information about Yubico privacy practices, including the lawful basis for processing of personal data, how to lodge a complaint with the supervisory authority, and how to contact Yubico to exercise your data subject rights. In this notice, when we refer to "Yubico", "us", "we" or "our", we mean the Yubico group company or companies that you apply to, or correspond with, and which are responsible for any personal data collected about you.**

title: Business Analyst for Digital Lending
company_industry: Banking, Investment Banking, and Financial Services
description:
**Description** 
 : Digital Lending consists of several cross-functional agile teams that design, build and maintain Lending products in digital customer channels (internet bank, mobile bank) for bank customers in Sweden.
 



  





**Main responsibilities:** 




  





 • Lead the work of gathering requirements from the business and other stakeholders.
 



 • Together with UX designers make our lending solutions for our customers as seamless as possible.
 



 • Express Product Backlog in terms of Jira User stories with acceptance criteria and other required details.
 



 • Plan, prioritize and estimate the work together with the team members, and Product Owner.
 



 • Define acceptance criteria and execute Business Acceptance tests.
 



  





**Requirements:** 




  





 • University degree (preferably in Computer Science, Information Technology, Mathematics, Statistics, Finance or Economics).
 



 • Proficient in requirements gathering, analysis, and documentation.
 



 • Strong understanding of software development processes, software architecture layers, API integrations.
 



 • Experience in agile way of working (preferable Scrum, SAFe frameworks).
 



 • Experience in working with Jira, Confluence, Figma tools.
 



 • Business domain knowledge within the Lending area is considered as an advantage.
 



 • Excellent communication skills and being fluent both in Swedish and English.

title: Motion Designer
description:
Established in 2004,
 **OLIVER** 
 is the world’s first and only specialist in designing, building, and running bespoke in-house agencies and marketing ecosystems for brands. We partner with over 300 clients in 40+ countries and counting. Our unique model drives creativity and efficiency, allowing us to deliver tailored solutions that resonate deeply with audiences.
   

  

 As a part of
 **The Brandtech Group** 
 , we're at the forefront of leveraging cutting-edge AI technology to revolutionise how we create and deliver work. Our
 **AI solutions** 
 enhance efficiency, spark creativity, and drive insightful decision-making, empowering our teams to produce innovative and impactful results.
   

  

**Motion Designer (6-month FTC with view to extend)**
 Location: Stockholm, Sweden (hybrid)
   

  

**Portfolio Is Required**
**About the role:**
 Are you passionate about motion design, and showcasing your creative and technical talents? We invite you to join our team as a skilled Motion Designer, where your expertise in creating animations, textures, high-quality 3D models, will bring innovative projects to life. Collaborating with a dynamic and diverse group of professionals, you will help redefine what's possible in motion design and 3D artistry while ensuring our projects meet the highest standards of quality and creativity.
   

  

 As a Motion Graphics Designer, you will support the team in executing high-quality design projects, motion graphics, and visual effects for various brands. This role combines hands-on design work with digital and visual design tasks, focusing on both 2D and occasionally 3D animation projects. Your ability to work in a fast-paced environment, coupled with your commitment to innovation and attention to detail, will drive the success of our projects.
   

  

 Reporting directly to the Creative Director the Motion Designer works alongside a multi-disciplinary dynamic team of creative professionals.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing** 
  

  

* Motion Graphics & Visual Effects:
+ Support the design and production of motion graphics, animations, and visual effects for advertisements, product videos, and promotional content
+ Assist in editing and refining animations for fluidity and consistency across various media
+ Create digital assets for social media platforms
+ If/When needed, support with graphic design/final art to ensure project deliveries

* Digital & Visual Design:
+ Contribute to concept development, visual design, and graphic design for various projects
+ Assist in developing post imagery and copy, ensuring relevance for multiple markets
+ Support the creation of layout and design for guidelines, toolkits, and strategic documents
+ Participate in film editing, post-production, and creation of digital video assets

* 3D Design & Animation
+ Assist in creating detailed 3D models, textures, lighting, and rendering for products, environments, and characters.
+ Contribute to the development of high-quality, photorealistic renders and animations.
+ Help optimize 3D assets for performance across different platforms and devices.

* Collaboration and Communication:
+ Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand project goals, target audience, and creative direction.
+ Communicate effectively with stakeholders to present ideas, progress updates, and final deliverables.
+ Participate in brainstorming sessions and contribute innovative ideas to enhance the overall design process.

* Technical Expertise:
+ Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and advancements in 3D/2D design and related technologies.
+ Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues related to 3D design & motion graphics software and workflows.
+ Mentor and train junior team members, sharing knowledge and best practices.

* Create detailed motion graphics, animations, and visual effects for various projects, including advertisements, product videos, and promotional content.
* Edit and refine animations to ensure flow.
* Develop high-quality, photorealistic renders and animations that meet project specifications and deadlines.
* Ensure all 3D assets are optimized for performance and compatibility across different platforms and devices.
* Create detailed 3D models, textures, lighting, and rendering for various projects, including products, environments, and characters.


**What You Need To Be Great In This Role**
* 5-7 years of relevant experience
* Show an innate creative flair with exemplary art direction and concepting skills, bursting with ideas that span across multiple platforms. Exhibit a love for exceptional design, motion graphics, and storytelling.
* Possess outstanding modelling, lighting, compositing, and animation skills. Be proficient in the Adobe Creative Suite, including Photoshop, Illustrator, and InDesign, and utilize tools like Substance Designer to craft both organic and inorganic textures and materials.
* Maintain exceptional attention to detail, ensuring no typos or pixelation, and demonstrate a strong grasp of typography, layout, and technical skills that accentuate your craftsmanship.
* Be curious, creative, and ambitious, using your understanding of responsive design, UX, and current social and digital technology trends to push the boundaries in every project.
* Effectively present and communicate ideas with both clients and team members, confidently leading discussions and fostering a collaborative, low-ego environment that values feedback and iteration.
* Show a keen interest in emerging technologies like AI, and possess advanced motion and video skills using After Effects and Premiere to design innovative solutions.
* Execute projects from concept to completion, exhibiting stellar communication, organisational, and time management skills while enjoying a hands-on approach with team collaboration.
* Apply comprehensive branding knowledge, ensuring consistency and quality across all forms of media.
* Experience in consumer goods, luxury, or drinks & beverages sectors preferred.
* Fluency in Swedish and English.

title: Product Design Leadership(Bangkok-Based, Relocation provided)
description:
Bangkok, Thailand
   

  

**About Agoda**
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Our Purpose –** 
**Bridging the World Through Travel**
 We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.
   

  

 We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.
   

  

**Getting to know our Agoda Design Team**
 Embark on a journey with the Agoda Design Team, a vibrant community of product designers crafting innovative solutions from the heart of Bangkok, Thailand, and Gurugram, India. As a pivotal force in our product-driven company, we collaborate closely with product managers and engineers to unravel customer challenges, shaping workflows, interactions, and visual interfaces. Whether you’re honing your craft, expanding your skillset, or stepping into a leadership role, now is the time to join a team that’s both scrappy and hands-on yet influential enough to drive change and shape product strategy. Be a part of Agoda’s Design team and contribute to unlocking the world for our global community of travelers.
   

  

**The Product Design Leader at Agoda is responsible for:**
 As a Product Design Leader at Agoda, you will oversee product design teams across a variety of business areas. You will be responsible for setting and executing the design vision, building high-performing teams, and ensuring design excellence and consistency across all touchpoints. This role is flexible and may be assigned to lead design for different product verticals as business needs evolve.
   

  

 You will manage and mentor Product Design Leads, Managers, and senior designers, and work closely with cross-functional partners in Product, Technology, and Business to drive impact at scale.
   

  

**In this Role, you’ll get to:**
* Design Strategy & Execution: Define and implement the product design strategy for assigned product areas (consumer, supply, enterprise, or internal tools), ensuring alignment with Agoda’s global design principles, usability, accessibility, and design system standards
* Team Leadership: Build, manage, and inspire a diverse team of Product Design Leads, Managers, and Senior Designers. Foster a culture of growth, inclusion, and high performance
* Cross-Functional Collaboration: Partner with Product, Technology, and Design leaders to align on strategy, drive execution, and maximize the impact and ROI of design
* Design Systems & Consistency: Champion the adoption and evolution of Agoda’s Design Systems, ensuring consistency and quality across all products and platforms
* Talent Development: Mentor and develop design talent, supporting career growth and building a thriving design community
* Product Roadmap Influence: Contribute to and help shape product roadmaps, balancing short-term delivery with long-term vision
* Performance & Impact: Set and track KPIs for design teams, reporting on performance and business impact
* Advocacy: Be a passionate advocate for user-centered design, bringing cross-functional partners into the research and design process


**What you’ll Need to Succeed:**
* 10+ years of design and UX leadership experience in high-traffic digital products (100,000+ daily users), ideally in e-commerce, marketplaces, or product-driven companies
* Proven experience leading and scaling design teams of 30+ people, including managers and senior ICs
* Strong people management, team development, recruiting, and organizational building skills
* Deep expertise in product design, design systems, and building end-to-end experiences in complex environments
* Track record of setting vision, strategy, and roadmaps, and aligning teams with business goals
* Experience driving cross-functional collaboration and influencing at the executive level
* Data-driven and strategic, with a strong ability to balance long-term vision with short- and medium-term goals
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills


**It’s Great if you have:**
* Experience in OTAs, e-commerce or product driven companies
* Experience managing Designer Managers & Principle level designers
* Experience in driving strategy & influencing product roadmaps
* Experience with utilization AI across design org operations, product output

 Working in partnership with our client, a renowned global leader in the drinks and beverages industry to recruit a talented Visual and Motion Designer. This role involves taking digital, print, and social content projects from concept to completion.

Collaborate with a multi-disciplinary dynamic team of 15 creative professionals, including Art Directors, designers, copywriters, project managers, UX designers, developers, and product managers, to shape and elevate our brand's visual identity. * An innate creative flair, interested in art direction and in developing concepting skills
* Strong knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite including Photoshop, Illustrator and InDesign.

title: Global Product Information Manager
description:
At Fjällräven, we create functional, durable, and timeless outdoor gear that inspires people to explore nature. To support this mission, we’re looking for a Global Product Information Manager who will ensure that every product is supported by accurate, consistent data, helping to maintain quality and streamline product information across all distribution channels.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As Global Product Information Manager, you will be part of the global digital marketing team at Fjällräven, working in close collaboration with our design, purchasing, and e-commerce teams to strengthen and grow our business.
   

  

 In this role, you will be responsible for the strategy, governance, enrichment, and distribution of product data across all retail channels. Your work will be essential in ensuring that product information is accurate, complete, and consistent- driving sales and delivering excellent customer experience.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Lead the end-to-end creation, enrichment, and delivery of seasonal product data and assets in the PIM system, ensuring alignment with internal teams and stakeholders.
* Act as the super admin for PIM (Inriver), Bynder (DAM), Partner Zone, and key stakeholder for the FJR data model.
* Own the accuracy, completeness, and timely availability of product information and assets across all channels, coordinating with marketing, R&D, E-commerce, and external partners.
* Manage the production and delivery of product texts and translations for seasonal and DTC products, including briefing copywriters and overseeing SEO integration.
* Drive the project management of seasonal hangtags, labels, QR codes, and NFC initiatives, ensuring seamless collaboration across departments.
* Serve as the primary contact for E-commerce projects related to product data, visuals, and content workflows.
* Oversee and support the Product Information team.
* Ensure efficient workflows and technical troubleshooting across systems including PIM, DAM, B2B Commerce, and CMS platforms.
* Maintain strong relationships with internal stakeholders and external vendors to continuously improve data quality, system integrations, and process efficiencies.


**What You’ll Deliver**
* Reduce return rates by ensuring product information is accurate and reliable.
* Guarantee a consistent and seamless user experience across all distribution channels.
* Enhance internal stakeholders’ ease of access to and use of product data.
* Strengthen brand value and perception through timely, up-to-date product information.


**Who You Are**
*Required Qualifications:*
* University degree (or equivalent) in marketing, communications, data strategy, or a related field.
* At least 5 years’ experience managing a PIM system or similar role handling large volumes of data.
* Proven project management experience, including working with senior stakeholders across product, design, creative, and marketing teams.
* Strong leadership and coaching abilities, with experience instructing and supporting PIM/DAM system users.
* Skilled at analysing processes and data to identify issues, trends, and develop effective solutions.
* Experience with budget planning.
* Experience with Monday.com is preferable.
* Excellent English and Swedish skills, both written and verbal.
* Experience in the clothing industry and/or working with seasons is meritorious.


*We Believe You Are Someone Who:*
* Is detail-oriented and thorough, while keeping the bigger picture in mind.
* Loves structure and clarity, ensuring data accuracy and smooth processes within the PIM system.
* Takes initiative and gets things done, both independently and as a collaborative team player.
* Thrives in a fast-paced, creative environment with multiple projects running simultaneously.
* Communicates clearly and builds strong relationships with diverse stakeholders.
* Approaches challenges with a positive, determined mindset and finds creative solutions.
* Continuously improves workflows and structures to optimize product information management.
* Manages time effectively, prioritizes tasks well, and sets clear deadlines for themselves and others.


**How To Apply**
 Apply now by submitting your resume in English through our application portal. We review applications on an ongoing basis, so don’t wait- the position may be filled before the closing date. We look forward to receiving your application!
   

  

 This position is based at our office in Solna. We support a flexible work environment, with four days in the office and one day per week to work from home.
