title: Backend Engineer – Installation and Customer Care
description:
10% of Europe’s CO₂ emissions are caused by residential heating, and energy bills are out of control. Aira is here to change that.
   

  

 With our intelligent Aira Heat Pump at the heart, we’re making the switch to clean energy-tech easier and more affordable. Helping Europe turn off gas and slashing energy costs one home at a time.
   

  

 Founded in 2022, and with 1000+ employees and counting, Aira is driving the clean energy revolution by providing homes with modern clean energy-tech solutions such as solar power, battery storage solutions and heat pumps. With a state-of-the-art production facility in Poland, an HQ in Stockholm, Sweden, and hubs across the UK, Germany, and Italy, Aira is well on track to install clean energy-tech into 5 million homes by 2034.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Backend Engineer on our Installations & Customer Care team, you'll help transform how clean energy gets delivered by empowering the field workforce with intuitive, data-driven tools. This team focuses on digitalizing installation operations and supporting ongoing maintenance and customer care. You’ll work at the intersection of software and real-world impact, building solutions that help installers and technicians do their best work every day.
   

  

 In this role, you will:
   

  

  

* Build intelligent backend systems that replace manual paperwork and disconnected workflows with scalable digital tools—bringing structure, traceability, and efficiency to field operations
* Develop services that simplify collaboration and handovers between installers, planners, and support teams, ensuring smooth transitions and fewer dropped balls across the customer journey
* Create platforms that collect and leverage operational data, helping us identify patterns, drive continuous improvement, and make smarter decisions at scale
* Design infrastructure that empowers a traditionally non-digital workforce to adopt and rely on intuitive tools, enabling them to focus on delivering high-quality installations
* Support post-installation care by enabling proactive maintenance, diagnostics, and revisit scheduling—improving long-term outcomes for both customers and the business
* Help us scale into new regions and markets by building flexible systems that adapt to varying local requirements, work practices, and service models


 We’re changing how clean energy is installed and maintained—making it smarter, faster, and better for everyone involved. If you’re excited about building backend systems that empower people in the field and drive tangible outcomes, this is the role for you.
   

  

**What You Bring To The Team**
* Solid experience with product-driven software development and agile environments
* Experience with Java and Spring Boot
* Automated testing at different levels (unit tests, integration tests etc.)


**Nice to have:**
* Rapid growth journeys (start-ups, scale-ups, new environments)
* Databases (DynamoDB/PostgreSQL)
* Event-driven architectures (Kafka)
* Cloud DevOps (Docker, Kubernetes, continuous delivery, logging, metrics)
* gRPC and Protobuf
* Terraform
* Kanban, Scrum, and/or a combination of both
* Digitalization and modernisation of manual labour


**What is in it for you?**
* Gain hands-on experience in a fast-growing scale-up, with a supportive and inclusive culture, and career advancement opportunities.
* Collaborate with diverse teams across international markets and launch products globally.
* Develop and grow personally and professionally in an entrepreneurial-minded environment.
* Thrive in a dynamic, solution-oriented culture, tackling challenges and driving meaningful solutions that make a positive impact on the world.
* Influence the company's success, with a visible impact on product development and market growth.
* Enjoy the flexibility of our hybrid work model and discover our brand-new office at Norra Stationsgatan 93 in Stockholm. Conveniently located near public transport, with Sankt Eriksplan and Odenplan stations just a few minutes' walk away


 At Aira, we champion the next-generation energy as well as diversity and inclusion. We firmly believe that a diverse workforce fosters innovation and creativity, enhancing our ability to serve customers and communities effectively. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives to join our team. Our commitment is to uphold equality and inclusivity, fostering a collaborative environment where everyone can thrive and contribute to a better future for our people and the planet.

title: Nordic HR Director Invent
description:
*At Capgemini Invent, we believe difference drives change. As inventive transformation consultants, we blend our strategic, creative and scientific capabilities, collaborating closely with clients to deliver cutting-edge solutions. Join us to drive transformation tailored to our client's challenges of today and tomorrow. Informed and validated by science and data. Superpowered by creativity and design. All underpinned by technology created with purpose.* 




  





**YOUR ROLE** 




 As the Nordic HR Director Invent and trusted advisor for the Global Business Line (GBL) Invent, you will be accountable for partnering with the “Nordics”, which comprises of two Invent Leadership teams; Norway and “SweDFi” (Sweden, Denmark & Finland). With the respective country leaders you will develop, direct and drive the overall Nordics Invent people agenda, incorporating both local and global priorities.
 



  





 You will work as a peer, with the respective Senior Leadership teams. You will understand the business strategy to translate it to a clear people strategy, focusing on priorities today and the longer-term strategy and then deliver on it. In addition, the role is accountable for ensuring efficient and effective delivery of the HR processes and other critical initiatives in the areas of talent management, performance management, skill & capability development and employee engagement.
 



  





 Capgemini is part-way through a People transformation program to become a more digital and agile player focusing on employee experience. HR digital transformation is a central part of this, by promoting true strategic HR Business partnering and show casing how to increase efficiency through HR Shared Services and Self Service. An ability to lead and participate in the continued HR transformation is necessary, to ensure that the HR function supports business growth and evolution.
 



  





 The Capgemini organization is a matrixed organization. This matrix impacts this role as well. While there are many programs and initiatives driven by the Invent GBL globally, there may be programs and initiatives that are driven by the country teams in the Nordics and the Capgemini Group. Initiatives are often aligned from a global and local standpoint but there may be some areas of differentiation that need to be managed carefully. The art of negotiation and influence without authority will be critical skill sets for the incumbent to ensure the multiple stakeholders are effectively managed.
 



  





 The role reports to the Invent HRD for Northern & Central Europe (NCE). There is leadership support both in Nordics and at the global level for the person in this role. The successful incumbent should, however, be able to work autonomously, focused on the unique needs of the Invent Nordics organization.
 



  





**YOUR PROFILE** 



* 10+ years of proven experience within HR
* Business orientation and very good communication skills with the ability to communicate across functions and cultures
* Relationship/Stakeholder Management – engaging in a positive way with multiple stakeholders who might have different focus at the same time
* Experience from working in an international surrounding and preferable in a matrix organization
* Experience from working with collective labor agreements, regulations
* Experience from business organizations, organizational development and/or change processes
* Change Management – leading change and coaching
* Hands on performance focus, strong drive and well-structured working methods
* Resilience, courage and integrity with the ability to build trust and confidence
* Agility - ability to work with a degree of ambiguity, in a matrixed environment and adaptable to rapid change
* An academic degree is preferred within relevant area or equivalent qualifications and working experience
* Fluent in English and a strong command in Swedish or any other Nordic language, both verbal and written



  





 As the Nordic HR Director for Invent, your responsibility will be to build effective and long-lasting, trusted relationships with key business stakeholders including senior leadership, Centers of Excellence (talent, recruiting, compensation & benefit, HR shared Services, etc). You will develop and deliver the people agenda for the Nordics Invent business, ensuring alignment with the Group and Invent HR strategy and the Nordics region. The role will support and drive the transformation agenda of Invent, including initiatives such as, Talent Development and Succession Planning.
 



  





*Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22.1 billion.*

title: Provningsingenjör till ledande industriaktör
description:
**Vill du vara med och testa tekniska lösningar som gör framtidens transporter mer energieffektiva och klimatsmarta? Just nu söker vi en driven och nyfiken testingenjör till ett team som arbetar med test och validering av värme-, ventilations- och luftkonditioneringssystem i lastbilshytter.**
**Att jobba som Provningsingenjör**
 Teamet du kliver in i ansvarar för att verifiera och validera prestanda, säkerhet och energieffektivitet i HVAC-lösningar för tunga fordon. Du kommer arbeta med moderna testverktyg som INCA, Canoe, Xcom och Gadget – tillsammans med kompetenta kollegor i ett teknikdrivet och hållbarhetsfokuserat företag. Teamet är engagerat i att tillsammans med partners och kunder driva omställningen mot ett mer hållbart transportsystem.
   

  

 Tjänsten är placerad i Södertälje och förväntas starta i slutet av augusti.
   

  

**Att vara konsult på Nexer Tech Talent**
 Som senior konsult hos Nexer Tech Talent blir du en del av ett nätverk av erfarna specialister. Du kommer att vara anställd av Nexer Tech Talent och arbeta som konsult hos kund, men möjlighet till anställning på sikt. Du kommer även att få ta del av ett skräddarsytt utbildningsprogram där du får möjlighet att utveckla och fördjupa dina tekniska kunskaper i områden som AI, Cloud och cybersäkerhet, men även inom tex. ledarskap och personlig utveckling.
   

  

 Vi kommer stötta och utmana dig genom hela uppdraget. Vi erbjuder också möjligheter att delta i nätverksträffar, inspirerande föreläsningar och sociala aktiviteter som stärker din roll i vårt konsultteam. Som konsult hos oss finns också möjlighet att bidra som mentor, där du kan dela med dig av din kunskap och erfarenhet till mer juniora kollegor.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som:**
* Har en utbildning som högskoleingenjör eller civilingenjör, gärna med inriktning mot maskinteknik, elektroteknik, energi eller fordonsteknik
* Har minst 2 års erfarenhet av provnings-/testarbete, gärna inom fordon, termodynamik eller klimat
* C-körkort och erfarenhet av verktyg som INCA, Canoe eller Xcom är meriterande
* Är självgående, kommunikativ och trygg i att samarbeta med olika intressenter
* Har goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska


**Ansökan**
 Låter detta som en spännande möjlighet? Vi rekryterar löpande, så skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt. Om du har frågor, kontakta Tech Recruiter Olivia Holm på olivia.holm@nexergroup.com.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
   

  

**Om Nexer Tech Talent**
 Nexer Tech Talent är en del av Nexer Group – ett techbolag med djupa rötter i svenskt entreprenörskap och innovation. Med över 2 500 medarbetare i 15 länder och mer än 35 års erfarenhet hjälper vi våra kunder att ligga steget före strategiskt, teknologiskt och kommunikativt. Läs mer om Nexer Tech Talent här.

title: Teamchef SAP Stockholm
description:
*Är du en engagerad och uppskattad ledare med passion för kundutveckling? Har du en proaktiv inställning och förmåga att skapa framgångsrika relationer? Då kan detta vara rollen för dig! Implemas SAP-team fortsätter att växa, och vi söker nu en Teamchef SAP, eller konsultchef som vi väljer att kalla det, som samtidigt vill jobba operativt som projektledare och service manager till vårt kontor i Stockholm.*
**Om rollen**
 Inom SAP-teamet framtidssäkrar vi våra kunders affärer med hjälp av SAP:s affärsplattformar S/4HANA, S/4HANA Cloud, Customer Experience (CX) och Business Technology Platform. Som konsultchef och projektledare/service manager på Implema får du en dynamisk och mångsidig roll där du kombinerar projektledning, kundutveckling och personalansvar.
   

  

***Teamchef***
 Implemas viktigaste tillgång är vår personal, och som teamchef är ditt främsta uppdrag att utifrån individuella behov säkerställa att personalen trivs och utvecklas på företaget. Det gör du genom att vara en coachande och närvarande chef som skapar förutsättningar för kontinuerlig vidareutveckling och säkerställer att dina konsulter har det stöd de behöver för att leverera högkvalitativt arbete hos våra kunder. Du arbetar aktivt med att bidra till och bibehålla den familjära, omhändertagande stämning som Implema är känt för. Som konsultchef blir du en del av vårt SAP ledningsteam.
   

  

***Projektledare/service manager***
 Som projektledare/service manager arbetar du med allt ifrån att projektleda och driva SAP projekt från förstudiefas till driftsättning, till att stödja existerande kunder på deras digitaliseringresa. Detta innefattar att leda och fördela arbetat inom kundteamen, planera och realisera uppgraderingar/releaser samt effektivisera kundens affärsprocesser utifrån deras behov och förutsättningar. Du har helhetsansvar för dina projekt och hanterar kundmöten, avtal, budget, planering, genomförande och uppföljning. En viktig del i rollen är också att stötta våra kunder med förändringsledning, som syftar till att kunden till fullo kan tillgodogöra sig värdet av gjorda investeringar.
   

  

******Är du vår nya kollega?******
 För att trivas i rollen har du erfarenhet av att bygga och underhålla starka affärsrelationer i en kundnära miljö. Du är uppskattad för dina starka kommunikationsegenskaper och förstår vikten av tydlighet i kommunikationen, externt såväl som internt. Med en gedigen erfarenhet av operativt SAP-arbete och projektledning, som gärna får ha varit ERP-projekt, är du van vid att arbeta enligt etablerade projektmetodiker.
   

  

 Vi tror du antingen haft personalansvar tidigare eller ser detta som ett naturligt nästa steg i din karriär, då du trivs i ledarrollen. Att hålla dig uppdaterad inom ditt expertområde är en självklarhet, och du har en god känsla för vad som fungerar i praktiken. Med ett konstruktivt förhållningssätt lyfter du gärna problem och utmaningar med fokus på att hitta hållbara lösningar.
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder?**
 Vi tror på ett arbetsklimat där kunskap delas, initiativ uppmuntras och varje medarbetare får utvecklas – både professionellt och personligt. Med höga ambitioner och högt i tak skapar vi en miljö där det är lätt att trivas. För oss är det viktigt med work-life-balance, och vi värnar om en trygg arbetsmiljö där du mår bra och känner dig sedd.
   

  

**Marknadsmässiga villkor och förmåner som stödjer dig**
 Utöver konkurrenskraftig lön erbjuder vi en flexibel hybridarbetsmodell, trygga pensions- och försäkringslösningar samt friskvårdsbidrag. Dessutom bjuder vi in på sociala aktiviteter som after work, kickoff och konferensresor
   

  

 Implema är en av Sveriges ledande specialister på att snabbt implementera affärssystem baserat på marknadens ledande affärssystem SAP och Microsoft Dynamics. Med mer än 20 års erfarenhet av affärskritiska projekt guidar Implema svenska och internationella företag till effektiva och hållbara affärsprocesser och den snabbaste vägen till framtidens affärssystem. Vi vill finnas nära våra kunder och har kontor på 10 orter runt om i Sverige och omsätter 500 MSEK. Vi växer och vill bli fler!

title: Regional Sales Representative (RSR), Northern Europe
description:
**Your Title:** 
 Regional Sales Representative (RSR), Northern Europe
   

  

**Job Location:** 
 Sweden - Danderyd or Remote: Sweden, Norway, Finland
   

  

**Division:** 
 Civil Construction Field Solutions CCFS
   

  

*Are you looking to be a part of an award-winning organization and one of the fastest growing technology companies that is transforming the construction landscape with innovative technology solutions?*
*Join our team! We will offer your versatile tasks in a diverse, inspiring and dynamic working environment with great colleagues. Apply as soon as possible! Please, submit your CV/application only in English.*
 In this position you will have a very specific focus on CEC Machine control solutions and Connected Site promotion with a primary focus on Northern Europe. You will be deeply involved in developing solid business relationships with Equipment Dealers.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
 You will provide sales and application support for distributors and potentially end users in the CEC product portfolio You will:
   

  

* Increase market share through the development of Connected Site solutions to existing accounts and new customers. You will also be able to develop customer interest on Trimble Continuum solutions to develop sales on the entire CEC solutions
* Sell through select and perhaps multiple channels of distribution and have large project involvement, and will develop strategic key end-user relationships to ensure the successful sale of all Trimble products and services. You will have a strong field presence across the Nordic region
* Be responsible for ongoing dealer development through the introduction, follow-up and ongoing involvement in Trimble’s channel development programs/workshops.


**Primary Responsibilities**
 You will report to the Nordic Regional Sales Manager. Together with the Regional Sales Manager, you will participate in the development and implementation of regionally assigned sales plans. You will be in interface with distributor management, operations, sales, service and support staff.
   

  

**You Will**
* Develop strong long term business development with regional equipment dealers and implementation of Trimble Technology Outlets
* Conduct on site distributor training and job site demonstrations together with the application engineers
* Be in interface with major regional accounts
* Conduct joint sales presentations with focus on Educational Presentations
* Drive the Annual Review Meetings with key accounts in each dealer territory
* Assist in the identification, procurement and subsequent training of distribution sales and application personnel
* Evaluate marketplace potential for all served markets and customer segments using Data Analytics services as available
* Assist in the development of and participation in, specific technical communications and training requirements such as Trimble Dimensions, Boot Camps, Construction News, and others
* Ensure new product release involvement by all dealers including local strategy, training and proper inventory
* Provide input on competitive products and activities primarily to the CCFS Business Area
* Assist in the identification and development of new distribution.


**What Skills, Experience And Knowledge You Should Bring**
* Proven experience of successful consultative sales
* Experience in Channel development and management
* Business, sales, market and domain knowledge in survey, civil engineering and / or construction
* Ideally experienced in Technology solutions for Construction
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Ability and willingness to travel up to+/- 75%
* Proficient knowledge of civil construction applications
* Product knowledge is a bonus
* Strong collaboration and relationship building skills
* Ability to prioritize, organize and manage multiple projects at one time
* Fluency in English and one Scandinavian language. Additional Nordic language skills are a bonus.


**About Our CCFS Division**
 Trimble's Civil Construction Field Solutions division focuses on providing advanced technology solutions to enhance productivity, accuracy, and efficiency in civil construction projects. This division integrates hardware and software tools to support the entire construction lifecycle, from initial site assessment and planning through to design, construction, and ongoing maintenance.
   

  

 Key offerings include machine control systems, site positioning systems, and software for project management and collaboration. These tools enable precise grading, excavation, paving, and site management, which help contractors and engineers streamline workflows, reduce rework, and improve overall project outcomes. For more information on currently developed products, see https://heavyindustry.trimble.com
   

  

**About Trimble**
 Dedicated to the world’s tomorrow, Trimble is a technology company delivering solutions that enable our customers to work in new ways to measure, build, grow and move goods for a better quality of life. Core technologies in positioning, modeling, connectivity and data analytics connect the digital and physical worlds to improve productivity, quality, safety, transparency and sustainability. From purpose-built products and enterprise lifecycle solutions to industry cloud services, Trimble is transforming critical industries such as construction, geospatial, agriculture and transportation to power an interconnected world of work. For more information about Trimble (NASDAQ: TRMB), visit: https://www.trimble.com/en
   

  

**Trimble’s Inclusiveness Commitment**
 We believe in celebrating our differences. That is why our diversity is our strength. To us, that means actively participating in opportunities to be inclusive. Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion have guided our current success while also moving our desire to improve. We actively seek to add members to our community who represent our customers and the places we live and work.
   

  

 We have programs in place to make sure our people are seen, heard, and welcomed and most importantly that they know they belong, no matter who they are or where they are coming from.
   

  

**Trimble’s Privacy Policy**
 #civilconstruction
   

  

 #fieldsolutions

title: Test engineer mechatronics
description:
Job Mission
  
We are now looking for an experienced test engineer for our development team. As test engineer you will be responsible developing tests to verify that new and old products meet their requirements, and continually improve our test methodology.
  
You need to be dedicated in your work, creative and be able to work in close cooperation with others.
  
Job Responsibilities
  
Develop the test plans, methodologies and conduct testing to ensure the products meet functional requirements.
  
Design test fixtures and develop automated test software. Select the test tools and equipment to be used for specified test efforts.
  
Support production department with new production tests and maintain current test systems.
  
Document test designs and procedures. Draft, review and maintain formal test procedures.
  
In this role you are required to act accordingly to the Piab Code of Conduct and know and follow the Piab values, mission and routines.
  
  

Key Interfaces
  
The test engineer reports to the team leader for software and electronics. The test engineer will work in close collaboration with the design engineers in the R&D department for automation.
  
Required Qualifications
  
* Excellent English-skills – verbal and written
* Excellent knowledge in Phyton
* Good knowledge in electronics design
* Knowledge in Matlab is a merit
* Bs. Or Masters in electrical engineering or related discipline
* 3 to 5 years experience as test engineer


Piab Values
  
Commit • Explore • Lead
  
All employees at Piab are committed to fulfill their responsibilities, have a strong on-hands mentality, and always do what they say. We are all exploring, trying new ways, and sharing ideas, to evolve automation, our business, and our customers. We lead by focusing, making decisions, and acting as role models when performing our jobs.
company_description: .In a world where no resources are wasted, and no humans are injured Piab, and our technology have an important role to play.

title: Quality engineer to a automotive company
description:
Do you have experience as a Supplier Quality Engineer and want to become a part of a world leading company? In this position you will be given the chance to join a passionate team working in a multicultural, open and dynamic environment.
  
  

**ABOUT THE POSITION:**  

The job as Supplier Quality Engineer (SQE) is exciting and often rewarding, working for the benefit of the Customer Satisfaction, in contact with multiple internal and external stakeholders. We are receiving roles in quality that involve various product areas such as plastics, metals, hardware, and software. You will join a passionate team working in a multicultural, open and dynamic environment, eager to develop and improve with all of our stakeholders, internal and external, in order to ensure the best quality of their products.
  
  

The main focus of the team is on performance, both on supplier results and its own efficiency. Opportunities exist for the SQE to attend internal continuous improvement activities aiming for leaner working processes.
  
  

From the sourcing stage up to the running production, the main tasks assigned to the SQE are:
  
  

To evaluate supplier lines and facilities, managing their development plan up to the excellence level required by our customers standards.
  
To support the new part developments, securing the suppliers ability to coat the parts according to the specification on robust manufacturing processes.
  
To lead the supplier continuous improvements as well as being entitled to steer strong reaction in case of supplier performance deviation.
  
To contribute to the Supplier Quality Global Network, working on new standard inputs, continuously improving the assessment tool and permanently monitoring the next technology and their opportunities.
  
  

**THE IDEAL CANDIDATE:**  

**The must-haves:**  

3-8 years of experience in the SQE area
  
Has the ability to travel for work.
  
Are fluent in English both spoken and written because the language is spoken internally/externally.
  
Driver licens
  
  

**The nice-to-haves:**  

Experience of the Automotiveindustry
  
Are fluent in Swedish both spoken and written
  
A great emphasis will be put on personal attributes where we are looking for someone that is curious, driven and has passion to be part of our clients target to shape the future of transportation and its supply chain. We also believe that you are a true team player with the ability to build and maintain strong relationships with your counterparts. Furthermore, you have a quality mindset and are interested in developing suppliers; you demonstrate excellent communication skills, and you are comfortable in cross functional and multicultural set-up.
  
  

**ABOUT THE ASSIGNMENT:**  

This is a consulting assignment which means that you will initially be employed by Friday. The ambition from the client and Friday is that the assignment will result in a permanent position.
  
  

**ADDITIONAL INFORMATION:**  

**Employment type:** Full time
  
**Start date:** As soon as possible
  
**Location:** Gothenburg
  
**Point of contact:** Stina Högström
  
**Salary:** Fixed monthly salary
  
Apply by clicking "Sök tjänst". Remember to be quick with your application as we make continuous selection of candidates, and the position can be filled before the application deadline is due.
  
  

**ABOUT FRIDAY:**  

By being a partner to our clients and candidates, we strive to find the best match for you both. We achieve this by really getting to know our clients and candidate’s needs! Of course, we will ensure that requirements and skillsets match. But above all, we focus on the importance to find harmony between values ​​and corporate culture which both candidate and client considers optimal.
  
  

Our passion is to help people find their dream job within the IT & Tech field. This ambition is a big part of the reason why Friday was founded, aiming to find that workplace that gives you the Friday feeling – every day!
  
  

We mainly focus on young engineers who are at the beginning of their careers or soon graduating from university within the IT and Technology field. Our belief is that people reach their fullest potential when looking forward to going to work.

title: Senior System Engineer
description:
Why join us?  

We’re on a mission to empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. As the world-leader in assistive communication solutions, we empower our customers to express themselves, connect with the world, and live richer lives.  

At Tobii Dynavox, you can grow your career within a dynamic, global company that has a clear, impactful purpose - with the flexibility to also do what truly matters to you outside of work. What’s more, you’ll be part of a work culture where collaboration is the norm and individuality is welcomed.  

As a member of our team, you’ll have the power to innovate for good. You’ll see your ideas in use in new applications, work with the latest technology on leading platforms, and deliver meaningful solutions for our customers.
We’re at an exciting stage in our journey—growing rapidly and expanding our Product & Development team in Stockholm to build a vibrant hub for innovation, product design, and technology. This is a unique opportunity to join a thriving organization where you can help shape the future of assistive communication, defining how we work and delivering impactful solutions for our users.
We are building a culture of empowered, collaborative teams who are passionate about helping individuals with disabilities find their voice and connect with the world. Our teams thrive on trust, collaboration, and a positive environment where everyone lead and contributes. We deeply understand the people we serve, empathize with their challenges, and use our expertise to make a real difference.
As a Senior Systems Engineer, you will join a team that plays a critical role in the design, development, and maintenance of Tobii Dynavox's speech-generating devices and accessories. You will be responsible for defining system requirements, leading system architecture design, and driving the seamless integration of hardware, firmware, and software components. Working with a cross-functional engineering team, you will ensure the delivery of reliable, user-centric solutions that empower individuals with communication challenges to express themselves and engage with the world, all while meeting the highest standards of performance, safety, and regulatory compliance.
In this role, you will:* Define system architectures and requirements, ensuring seamless integration of hardware, firmware, and software, while managing performance, cost, and troubleshooting.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to define system requirements, manage risks, and ensure regulatory compliance (FDA Class II, MDR), including maintaining technical documentation.
* Develop and execute system verification plans, support product lifecycle management, and drive continuous improvements from design transfer to post-market issues.
* Mentor junior engineers, collaborate with cross-functional teams, and promote technical excellence and innovation across the organization.
* Support broader organizational objectives as needed.

What We're Looking For:
We are looking for someone that has:* Bachelor’s or Master’s in Systems Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Computer Science, or related field, with 8+ years in system design, development, and integration, preferably in regulated industries.
* Strong experience in system architecture, hardware-software integration, risk management, and familiarity with medical device regulations (FDA, EU MDR, ISO 13485).
* Skilled in systems engineering tools for modeling and requirements management, with expertise in troubleshooting and balancing performance, cost, and compliance.
* Strong communicator with leadership skills, capable of working in cross-functional teams.

Apply today!
We believe in empowering individuals - including our own employees - to reach their full potential. So, if you want to change lives while growing your own career, we’d love to hear from you.
company_description: Tobii Dynavox’s mission is to empower people with disabilities to do what they once did, or never thought possible.

title: Java developer
description:
We are looking for two experienced Java Developers to join an agile, value-driven team. In this role, you will work closely with the business, contributing throughout the entire development lifecycle – from idea to delivery. The focus is on quality, automation, and continuous improvements. The assignment also includes documentation and knowledge transfer to the client’s team. The work environment promotes collaboration and short feedback loops.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 - System development primarily focused on Java (Java Spring).
   

 - Work with application servers, mainly JBoss.
   

 - Build and maintain CI/CD pipelines and manage container solutions using Docker and Kubernetes.
   

 -Development and maintenance of core technical components related to security and identity management (OAuth2, OpenID Connect, SAMLv2, secrets management, certificate handling).
   

 -Work with API management (WSO2) and microservices.
   

 -Some tasks involving frontend development and DevOps activities (infrastructure, pipelines, and environment configuration).
 


**Job requirements** 

 To be successful in this role, we believe that you have experience with:
   

  

  Java Spring Boot, Docker, Kubernetes, JBoss, Kafka, Maven, Jira, Confluence, Postman, Vue, Harbor, Nexus, MQ Explorer
 


**Application procedure** 

 A Maandag® recruiter will assess your application as soon as possible to determine whether you are suitable for an open position.
   




**About the company** 

 If you are a good match, we would like to receive a CV in WORD format with motivation why you fit this assignment, your availability and any scheduled holidays.
   

  

 Why Maandag Nordic? With us, you’ll get the chance to really put your ideas into action. We offer a work environment where you can grow and learn through hands-on experience - trying things out, making mistakes, and improving.
 



 For more than 35 years, Maandag® has been at the forefront of empowering people and organisations. We not only help professionals get jobs, but also connect them with a future that matches their values, desires and ambitions. Because when people are truly in the right place, they can develop themselves, fulfil their dreams and go to work with fresh energy every day. The energy and power released in the process is a catalyst for growth for companies. We started in the Netherlands, but now we also help professionals and organisations in Belgium, Poland, Dubai and Sweden. Our extensive knowledge of different markets, coupled with our wide network, enables us to make perfect matches quickly.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
**👨‍💻 Senior Software Engineer – Web Tech Builder**
 MSAB is on the hunt for a Senior Software Engineer who gets a kick out of building stuff from scratch and geeking out with a crew of skilled coders. Our Unify Core Technology (UCT) team is all about creating the future of web dev at MSAB, and we want someone who loves rolling up their sleeves, simple, fast and maintainable code, and having a blast while doing it. Bonus: you’ll be helping fight crime!
   

  

 🚀 About MSAB
   

  

 We believe that you are dreaming of using your technical skills and your innovative mindset to create a better democratic world. Especially by solving crimes, gathering intelligence, investigating fraud and fighting corruption. At MSAB we make that dream come true!
   

  

 MSAB is one of the world’s leading digital forensic companies. We develop digital forensic solutions for mobile device examination and analysis used globally. Working with programming you will perform demanding tasks that tickles your innovative mindset and challenge your technical skills to find your way forward towards a solution.
   

  

**🎯 What You'll Be Doing**
* Building slick, high-performance web apps from the ground up, with a focus on speed and user happiness.
* Teaming up with a group of passionate nerds who love coding as much as you do.
* Shaping our web tech foundation by crafting tools and systems with serious attention to detail.
* Diving into binary formats, gRPC, and Protocol Buffers to make our systems hum.
* Using Playwright to write rock-solid tests that ensure our apps are bulletproof.


**🧠 What We're Looking For**
* A JavaScript/TypeScript wizard who knows their way around modern web dev.
* Handy with HTML, CSS, and Web APIs, making interfaces that are smooth and snappy.
* A bit obsessed with making things fast, sweating the small stuff that keeps apps zippy.
* Comfortable with binary formats, gRPC, and Protocol Buffers for tackling tricky data challenges.
* Pumped about building from scratch, skipping bloated frameworks, and creating lean, custom solutions.
* Someone who vibes with a team, loves sharing ideas, and enjoys a good code nerd-out.


**🧰 Our Tech Stack**
* HTML/CSS/TypeScript for clean, solid front-end code.
* Next.js SPA (React and React Router) for dynamic, speedy web apps.
* Caddy as our lightweight web server.
* gRPC-web for fast, scalable communication.
* Playwright for writing reliable, end-to-end tests.
* We keep dependencies light, building what we need with care and precision.


**🌍 What We Offer**
 Join a company that's making a real difference. At MSAB, you'll find a collaborative environment, opportunities for professional growth, and the chance to be part of a mission that matters. We are working in a hybrid office model so you can meet your peers as well as working from home.
   

  

 Department Development Locations Stockholm, Sweden Remote status Hybrid

title: Backend Engineer - Finance Tech Team
description:
**About The Role**
 At Instabee, our Finance Tech team is a driving force behind the company’s financial operations, ensuring everything runs with precision and efficiency. We are the bridge between operations, commerce and finance. Our mission is to power seamless money flows, optimize pricing strategies, and leverage technology to keep our financial ecosystem strong and future-ready.We don’t just enable the business—we shape its profitability and financial success. Working closely with our commercial and financial teams, we integrate commercial tools with financial systems, ensuring that money moves efficiently and accurately across the company. Whether it’s evaluating the latest external software or building world-class internal tools, we are at the core of Instabee’s growth and financial excellence.
   

  

**Some of the things you will do**
* Invoicing & Process Optimization – Ensure our invoicing runs smoothly and efficiently by refining existing workflows and eliminating errors.
* System Analysis & Improvement – Review and analyze our current systems to identify opportunities for improvement and increased efficiency.
* Quality & Reliability – Take ownership of system reliability, ensuring stability and high performance.
* Collaboration – Work cross-functionally with Finance, Commercial, and Product teams to integrate backend solutions seamlessly.
* Innovation & Development – Drive innovation and develop future-proof solutions that align with company goals.
* Staying curious – Stay updated on relevant technologies and evaluate how they can benefit our systems and workflows.


**Your future team**
 The Finance Tech team operates with a high level of autonomy, empowering you to make a significant impact on our systems and processes. Your contributions will directly influence Instabee’s ability to optimize revenue streams, strengthen financial operations, and maintain a cutting-edge financial infrastructure.
   

  

 You’ll work side by side with senior leaders across finance and Commercial teams, collaborating with Product and Engineering Managers to develop and advocate for innovative solutions. We expect you to bring bold ideas, strong reasoning, and a data-driven mindset to the table - because here, your voice matters.
   

  

**What We're Looking For**
 At Instabee we value individuals who are keen to learn and develop their own skill set. If you're a problem solver who loves coding and making complex things work, then this is the place for you. Beyond that we imagine that you have some of the following points on your resumé:
   

  

* Strong experience in a backend or fullstack role within a modern tech environment
* Proficiency in JavaScript/TypeScript, with a passion for building scalable solutions
* PostgreSQL and/or MongoDB experience (or equivalent database technologies)
* Basic understanding of Terraform and Linux
* Familiarity with GCP
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English


***The cherry on top would be if you…***
* Have experience within financial services or a strong interest in the financial sector is a plus


 If this is you then we can’t wait to meet you!
   

  

**What You’ll Get**
 We can promise you that you will be challenged, develop your skills and have the opportunity to work with truly amazing and competent colleagues. If you like changes and want to set new processes and ways of working - this is the place for you!
   

  

**Benefits**
 Of course, we have all the necessary and standard benefits in place, but in addition to this, we can also offer:
   

  

* 🌇 Sky-High Office: Modern and newly renovated with a 360-degree view around Stockholm.
* 🐶 Puppy Friendly: Bring your dog to work - we've got a whole floor for our furry friends!
* 🏓 Fun & Games: Ping pong, Shuffleboard, Foosball, and even a Karaoke Room for your leisure time.
* 👶 Parental Pay for Six Months: Step away from work and provide the best care and love to your little one.
* 🎂 A Day Off on Your Birthday: We love to celebrate, so enjoy your birthday to the fullest with a day off each year!m for your leisure time.
* ⏰ Flexible Hours: Hybrid setup with working hours that adapt to your lifestyle.
* 🥐 Wednesdays Tech Breakfasts: Fuel your midweek with tech talks and tasty bites.
* 👾 Tech Demos: Dive into the latest innovations with our regular tech showcases.
* 💻 Modern Tech Stack: Work with cutting-edge technology every day.


 Diversity and inclusion is very important to us and we are committed to creating an inclusive work environment. We want to be a workplace where everyone’s perspectives and opinions are valued, and we are dedicated to creating opportunities for all employees to thrive and reach their full potential.
   

  

**Get to know us**
 In 2022, Instabee was founded after combining Budbee and Instabox - two leading last-mile delivery companies with three consumer-facing brands: Budbee, Instabox, and Porterbuddy. Instabee serves millions of consumers across Europe with convenient deliveries and is on track to become the leading European e-commerce enabler. Always with the consumer at heart.
   

  

 We’re fast, both in terms of parcel delivery and when it comes to growing our business. So far our journey has taken us from Sweden to the rest of Scandinavia and parts of continental Europe, but we have no plans on stopping anytime soon. As we continue to expand, the complexity of Instabee grows in parallel. With that in mind, we’re now looking for you to help us on the journey ahead.
   

  

*This recruitment process consists of background checks via Verifiera as a review of previous public criminal records. The result is public information that is handled confidentially. This is mandatory for all recruitment processes at Instabee in Sweden.*

title: Senior Full Stack Engineer
description:
**What We Should Tell You About The Company**
 Filed is building the
 **first AI tax preparer** 
 trusted by America’s accounting firms. This industry might seem boring—but it’s a $70B backbone of the economy that’s breaking under a talent shortage no one has solved. We’re fixing it—fast.
   

  

 In just 9 months, we’ve hit
 **strong product-market fit** 
 , are generating insanely
 **fast-growing, ridiculously sticky revenue** 
 , and are
 **backed by top-tier investors** 
 . We’re not a tool—we’re the missing workforce firms have been sounding the alarm for. We’re building the future with expanding our already 30 person team, with those who want to say
 **“I was there when it all started.”**
 https://techcrunch.com/2025/05/21/filed-raises-17m-to-automate-the-drudgery-of-tax-prep/
   

  

 ⸻
   

  

**What We Should Tell You About The Role**
 We’re looking for a full-stack engineer who moves fast and thrives in high-velocity environments. You’re the kind of person who sees a broken workflow, understands the root cause quickly, and ships a fix in hours—not weeks. You love turning ambiguity into working software, and you don’t wait around for perfect specs to start building.
   

  

 You’re a generalist who’s just as comfortable spinning up a backend service as you are crafting a clean, responsive UI. You sweat the details, but never let them block progress. You think in terms of speed, value, and iteration—always asking: how can we get this in front of users faster?
   

  

 As one of our earliest engineers, you’ll help shape the core product and infrastructure. You’ll work closely with design, ML, and actual tax pros to reinvent how this industry works—by shipping fast, learning fast, and doing what others said couldn’t be done.
   

  

 Our product and engineering team is based in
 **Stockholm** 
 . We’re prioritising local candidates, but will
 **consider candidates from elsewhere in the EU, who can travel to Stockholm.**
 ⸻
   

  

**Here’s Why This Is a Terrible Job**
* This is not a job for someone who likes to move slow.
* We operate week to week with ruthless speed. Sometimes we’re going in the wrong direction, but more times than not we’re going in the right direction.
* If you need a few extra days to perfect your code, chances are there’s already a handful of team members blocked behind you.
* We use tools like Cursor to move fast, test ideas in days, and ship extremely fast.
* You’ll be operating at the intersection of product logic, machine learning, user psychology, and highly regulated workflows.
* There are no clear answers. Just judgment calls, ambiguity, and constant input from every direction.
* You’ll ask yourself, is this really the work? It is. And it’s not for everyone.


 ⸻
   

  

**Here's Why It's The Best Career Choice You'll Make**
* We’re building what tax pros call impossible. A product that behaves like a teammate, not just another tool.
* We run reviews every 4 months. We operate with total transparency around pay, performance, and progress.
* You’ll be paid above market. You’ll earn equity that grows fast. And you’ll have full autonomy to make high-impact decisions.
* You’ll ship code because you believe in it, not because it got signed off.
* You’ll talk to customers weekly. You’ll drive outcomes end to end.
* We’ll tell you what needs to be achieved. How you get there is on you.
* We expect you to build a customer Oracle. An internal simulator so dialed in that you can predict exactly what your user needs before you ever talk to them.
* That comes from immersion, curiosity, and care.


 ⸻
   

  

**The Teammate We're Looking For**
* Thrives at solving complex, technical product problems
* Moves seamlessly between systems thinking and detailed execution
* Excited by the challenge of serving multiple user groups and workflows
* No lone wolves — we need a collaborative engineer
* Big bonus if you have a track record of owning product outcomes, not just tasks


 ⸻
   

  

**What You’ll Be Responsible For**
* Architecting and building complex workflows across the full stack
* Co-owning the entire product experience from backend to frontend
* Driving product direction through technical execution and intuition
* Becoming an Oracle with a best-in-class customer model in your head


 ⸻
   

  

**Your Hard Skillset**
* Deep experience across backend and frontend systems
* Fluency in TypeScript, Python, or similar modern stacks
* Comfortable with infra, APIs, databases, and debugging messy edge cases
* Bonus if you’ve used AI tools to accelerate development
* Even bigger bonus if you’ve worked in regulated or high-trust domains


 ⸻
   

  

**Your Soft Skillset**
* Comfortable being uncomfortable and making calls with incomplete data
* Empathetic and curious — building for the user, not just for elegance
* Highly collaborative across product, design, and customer support
* Detail-oriented but pragmatic — you know when polish matters and when to move
* You own your work and welcome the accountability that comes with it


 ⸻
   

  

**Growth And Levels**
 We operate on six levels, from Level 1 to Level 6. Each reflects increasing ownership, impact, and scope with meaningful jumps in salary and equity.
   

  

 We review levels every 4 months. Promotions are based on output and ownership, not tenure.
   

  

 This isn’t a comfy engineering role. It’s fast, focused, and customer-obsessed.
   

  

 You will build fast. You will learn fast. You will own what you ship.
   

  

 ⸻
   

  

**The Process**
* Quick intro call (30 minutes)
* Code walkthrough and async task (60 minutes)
* Final round with our team (120 minutes)


 In just 3.5 hours, you’ll be wanting early access, just like the rest of our team—to dive into the codebase and help build a generational company, even before you start as you'll be able to see the opportunity to transform your career.
   

  

 Compensation Range: $82.5K - $143K

title: Software Engineer to Lending Development
company_industry: Banking, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Software Development
description:

 In Swedbank you have the opportunity to:
   

  

* Develop, test, analyse and maintain applications in Swedbank´s high tech systems.

 be a part of an international team of professionals, who are jointly delivering challenging projects, maximizing customer value and increasing Swedbank’s competitive advantage."-
 **Mia Renmarker,**

title: Senior React Native Developer
description:
****Sambla Group is a fast-growing fintech company with the clear goal of empowering customers to improve their personal finances and provide them with the best consumer finance products in the industry. Backed by a winning mindset and over 400 colleagues in 4 countries, we have successfully helped more than 1 million customers improve their financial situation by consolidating their personal loans and helping them seek better terms.****
**We’re hiring a Senior React Native Developer** 
 to accelerate our mobile app as we expand across new product verticals and Nordic markets. You’ll join a high‑priority, cross‑functional team shaping how customers discover, qualify, and manage consumer finance with Sambla on mobile.
   

  

 If you’re forward‑leaning and love product development, you’ll thrive balancing rapid iteration with technical excellence. Making pragmatic trade‑offs, laying strong foundations, and shipping outcomes through experiments, analytics, and continuous delivery.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* End‑to‑end development of our React Native app across multiple verticals and markets.
* Architect modular, scalable code (TypeScript, state management, navigation) and evolve our design system.
* Collaborate with Product, Design, and our other product teams to scope, slice, and ship features quickly and safely.
* Raise the quality bar via testing, observability, performance profiling, and security‑by‑default.
* Own CI/CD, release cadence, and rollouts; drive A/B tests and data‑driven iterations.
* Mentor peers, champion best practices, and improve developer experience.


**What we are looking for:**
* 5+ years building mobile apps, 3+ years with React Native and TypeScript; shipped apps at scale.
* Strong RN ecosystem knowledge (navigation, state, animations), native bridges/modules (iOS/Android), and performance.
* Product mindset: discovery, slicing MVPs, experimentation, and measuring impact.
* Solid API experience, testing, analytics, feature flags, and release management.
* Pragmatic engineer who balances speed and quality; invests in maintainability and reliability.
* Nice to have: fintech, regulated environments, accessibility, localization, and multi‑market rollouts.


**Why this role?**
* Customer‑first by design, we help people strengthen their everyday finances.
* High‑impact, company‑priority initiative with strong leadership support and clear ownership.
* Shape a multi‑vertical, multi‑market product used across the Nordics.
* Autonomy to move fast while investing in architecture, tooling, and quality.
* Grow alongside talented teammates in a collaborative, data‑driven culture.


**What we offer:**
* Business in mind & people at heart – we deliver results together and celebrate our achievements.
* A varied and challenging role in a multinational and highly innovative company, where we value the development of our employees
* We are strong believers in creating a fun workplace where people enjoy coming to work.
* A friendly culture with openness and respect for one another, with the possibility to influence and make a difference on society and people’s everyday lives.


 Please note!
   

  

 As part of our efforts to foster an unbiased recruitment process, we kindly encourage you to not include picture, gender, ethnicity, religion, disability, sexual orientation or age in your CV.

title: Frontend Engineer – Growth Web
description:
**Join Aira's mission to transform Europe's energy future**
 Are you passionate about building exceptional web experiences that drive growth and build iconic brands? Join Aira, a pioneering Swedish tech company, and help us craft our digital front door with cutting-edge frontend technology!
   

  

 Aira is at the forefront of clean energy technology. 10% of Europe's CO₂ emissions are caused by residential heating, and energy bills are out of control. Aira is here to change that.
   

  

 With our intelligent Aira Heat Pump at the heart, we're making the switch to clean energy-tech easier and more affordable. Helping Europe turn off gas and slashing energy costs one home at a time.
   

  

 Founded in 2022, and with 1000+ employees and counting, Aira is driving the clean energy revolution by providing homes with modern clean energy-tech solutions such as solar power, battery storage solutions and heat pumps. With a state-of-the-art production facility in Poland, an HQ in Stockholm, Sweden, and hubs across the UK, Germany, and Italy, Aira is well on track to install clean energy-tech into 5 million homes by 2034.
   

  

**We are now looking for a talented Frontend Engineer to join our team in Stockholm, focusing on our public website and lead generation platform.**
 This is a unique opportunity to take technical ownership of our most visible platform, ensuring it not only converts visitors into leads but also consistently elevates our brand perception through high-performance, scalable web solutions.
   

  

**What You'll Be Doing**
* Engineer high-impact web applications using React and Next.js — not just shipping features, but shaping how our lead generation platform drives measurable business results. You’ll own both the discovery and technical implementation, ensuring our public website scales with business needs.
* Turn business goals into technical architecture. You’ll work closely with product, marketing, and data teams to translate requirements into scalable systems that optimize for conversions, performance, and future growth.
* Optimize for performance and discoverability. From Core Web Vitals to SEO strategy and A/B testing infrastructure, you’ll design solutions that allow the company to make informed, data-driven decisions.
* Architect and integrate headless CMS workflows that empower non-technical teams while maintaining engineering quality, performance, and scalability.
* Own reliability at scale. You’ll deploy and maintain production applications on Vercel, establish CI/CD pipelines, monitor key metrics, and ensure near-perfect uptime for a mission-critical lead generation platform.
* Shape the product as much as the code. Beyond development, you’ll participate in discovery and decision-making — influencing how we reach 5 million homes by 2034.


**What You'll Bring To The Role**
* React & Next.js expertise — 3+ years building production-grade applications using modern patterns (SSR, SSG, ISR, API routes)
* Systems thinking — ability to design, scale, and evolve architecture in line with fast-moving business needs
* Vercel deployment experience — hands-on knowledge of edge functions, performance tools, and CI/CD best practices
* Headless CMS integration — proven track record with Contentful, Sanity, Strapi, or similar
* SEO mastery — deep knowledge of technical SEO and Core Web Vitals optimization
* A/B testing & CRO — ability to set up experimentation frameworks and act on behavioral data
* Data-driven development — comfort working with analytics and using insights to shape technical decisions


**Essential Skills:**
* TypeScript proficiency
* Advanced CSS skills (Tailwind CSS preferred)
* API integration and data fetching optimization
* Multi-language/international site development
* Performance monitoring and debugging
* Multi-language/international website development


**Professional Requirements:**
* 4 days per week in our Stockholm office
* Strong English communication skills
* Experience working in fast-paced, growth-focused environments


**Please note**
 As summer is a time when many of our team members are on vacation, our recruitment process will be slower than usual. We may not be able to review applications and start interviewing until early August, once everyone is back.
   

  

 Thank you for your patience and understanding. We truly appreciate your interest in joining us, and we look forward to connecting with you soon!
   

  

**What is in it for you?**
* Gain hands-on experience in a fast-growing scale-up, with a supportive and inclusive culture, and career advancement opportunities
* Collaborate with diverse teams across international markets and launch products globally
* Develop and grow personally and professionally in an entrepreneurial-minded environment
* Thrive in a dynamic, solution-oriented culture, tackling challenges and driving meaningful solutions that make a positive impact on the world
* Influence the company's success, with a visible impact on product development and market growth
* Work with cutting-edge frontend technologies and modern development practices
* Enjoy our brand-new office at Norra Stationsgatan 93 in Stockholm. Conveniently located near public transport, with Sankt Eriksplan and Odenplan stations just a few minutes walk away


 At Aira, we champion next-generation energy as well as diversity and inclusion. We firmly believe that a diverse workforce fosters innovation and creativity, enhancing our ability to serve customers and communities effectively. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives to join our team. Our commitment is to uphold equality and inclusivity, fostering a collaborative environment where everyone can thrive and contribute to a better future for our people and the planet.

title: AI Engineer
description:
*Som en del av vårt AI-team får du chansen att arbeta i framkant av den teknologiska utvecklingen och forma framtidens AI-lösningar. Vi är ett innovativt och samarbetsorienterat team som fokuserar på att skapa lösningar som gör skillnad, både för våra kunder och våra medarbetare. Hos oss får du möjlighet att bidra till att bygga skalbara, robusta och användarvänliga AI-lösningar som spelar en central roll för vår verksamhet.*
**Om jobbet**
 Som AI-Engineer med fokus på generativ AI på Länsförsäkringar AB blir du en nyckelperson i vårt tvärfunktionella spjutspetsteam med fullstack-kompetens. Vi bygger lösningar från ax till limpa och arbetar med hela livscykeln för våra applikationer. Hos oss får du möjlighet att arbeta brett över alla lager i applikationen och utveckla din förståelse för hur moderna AI-system fungerar i praktiken.
   

  

 Vi arbetar med flera plattformar, dels exponerade mot slutkund, och dels interna system som används av våra medarbetare. En av våra mest centrala plattformar är vår interna GPT-lösning, som används av över 6000 medarbetare för att effektivisera arbetsflöden och beslutsfattande.
   

  

 Rollen är fokuserad kring tre huvudsakliga områden:
   

  

* Språkmodeller Utveckla lösningar som använder språkmodeller och agentteknik för att förstå användarens behov, identifiera relevant information och fatta beslut kring hur denna information ska användas. Du arbetar med tekniker som retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), prompt engineering och agentramverk för att skapa kraftfulla och användarvänliga AI-drivna upplevelser.
* Databearbetning Bygg skalbara och robusta datapipelines som gör det möjligt för användare att ladda upp filer och extrahera relevant information. Du ansvarar för att konvertera, strukturera och lagra data i olika former, som exempelvis objektlagring, vektor- eller grafdatabaser, och bygger integrationer mot andra system för att tillgängliggöra information.
* Operationalisering Arbeta med att säkerställa att våra generativa AI-lösningar är robusta, säkra och skalbara i praktiken. Det innebär att hantera hela driftsättningen och livscykelhanteringen av plattformarna – från övervakning och felsökning till prestandaoptimering och rättighetshantering. Du ser till att lösningarna uppfyller de höga krav på säkerhet och dataskydd som gäller inom finansiell verksamhet och skapar förutsättningar för god observerbarhet.


**Vår teknikstack**
 Vi använder en flexibel teknikstack för att bygga och skala våra lösningar:
   

  

* Språk: Python, Javascript, Typescript
* Databaser: MongoDB, PostgreSQL, Redis
* Frontend: React.js, Tailwind, DaisyUI
* API Gateway: Nginx
* Plattform: Azure Container Apps – Planeras för Kubernetes
* Backend: FastAPI, Celery
* Lokal utvecklingsmiljö: Docker Compose, WSL, VS Code med GitHub Copilot
* CI/CD: Azure Devops
* IaC: Bicep


**Vem är du?**
**För att trivas och lyckas i denna roll ser vi att du har kunskap inom några av följande områden:**
* Backendutveckling: Erfarenhet av Python och gärna FastAPI för att bygga API:er. Kunskap inom Celery och asynkron programmering är meriterande.
* Databaser: Erfarenhet av att arbeta med MongoDB och PostgreSQL som applikationsdatabaser. Kunskap om vektor- och grafbaserad datahantering är ett plus.
* Frontendutveckling: Grundläggande kunskaper i React.js och Tailwind CSS är meriterande, men inte ett krav.
* Molnplattformar: Erfarenhet av att arbeta med Azure och containerlösningar som Kubernetes är fördelaktigt.
* CI/CD och DevOps: Erfarenhet av att arbeta med Azure DevOps eller liknande SCM-plattformar samt förståelse för och hantering av CI/CD-pipelines.
* Infrastruktur som kod (IaC): Erfarenhet av att använda Bicep eller andra IaC-verktyg är meriterande.
* Praktisk erfarenhet av att integrera LLMs i olika lösningar är meriterande.
* Samverkande och kommunikativ: Du trivs i tvärfunktionella team och kan kommunicera lösningar till både tekniska och icke-tekniska intressenter.


**Vi söker någon som:**
* Har ett intresse av att skapa en helhetsbild och utveckla ett systemtänk, även om du inte har expertkunskap inom alla områden.
* Är nyfiken och villig att lära dig och växa inom olika delar av stacken.
* Är självgående men också samarbetsvillig och löser problem effektivt tillsammans med andra.
* Trivs i en dynamisk och innovativ arbetsmiljö där du får bidra till att bygga framtidens lösningar.


**Om oss**
 Välkommen till Sak på Länsförsäkringar AB! Vi är stolta över att vara i centrum av den teknologiska utvecklingen och leverera innovativa IT-lösningar som driver vår verksamhet framåt. Genom att alltid ligga steget före säkerställer vi en IT-miljö som är både säker och skalbar, vilket gör det möjligt för våra affärsenheter att nå nya höjder.
   

  

 Vi är ett team på 14 personer som brinner för samarbete, kunskapsdelning och ny teknik. Majoriteten av oss är data scientists, men vi växer även med AI Engineers, arkitekter och DevOps Engineers. Tillsammans leder vi AI-utvecklingen inom Länsförsäkringar och skapar lösningar som gör skillnad.
   

  

 Hos oss blir du en viktig del i en spännande resa där vi tillsammans formar framtidens AI. Vill du vara med och göra skillnad? Sök idag!
   

  

**Mer information**
*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*
**Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-09-11**

title: Backend Engineer - Customer Solutions
description:
10% of Europe's CO₂ emissions are caused by residential heating, and energy bills are out of control. Aira is here to change that.
   

  

 With our intelligent Aira Heat Pump at the heart, we're making the switch to clean energy-tech easier and more affordable. Helping Europe turn off gas and slashing energy costs one home at a time.
   

  

 Founded in 2022, and with 1000+ employees and counting, Aira is driving the clean energy revolution by providing homes with modern clean energy-tech solutions such as solar power, battery storage solutions, and heat pumps. With a state-of-the-art production facility in Poland, an HQ in Stockholm, Sweden, and hubs across the UK, Germany, and Italy, Aira is well on track to install clean energy-tech into 5 million homes by 2034.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Backend Engineer on our Customer Solutions team, you'll build the intelligent systems that power Aira's growth across Europe. This role sits within our Customer Acquisition area, where you'll develop critical backend infrastructure including intelligent recommendation systems, dynamic pricing optimization, and market expansion capabilities. Working in an agile environment with cross-functional teams, you'll help scale our technical platform across diverse European markets while handling complex technical and regulatory requirements.
   

  

 In this role, you will:
   

  

  

* Build and maintain our customer solution matching platform—the backend systems that analyze customer inputs and property characteristics to recommend optimal clean energy solutions
* Develop scalable backend services that enable market teams with pricing capabilities and support company bets on new products through intelligent algorithms
* Create flexible, event-driven systems that can easily onboard new clean energy products and adapt to different markets, currencies, and regulatory requirements
* Design and implement APIs and microservices that support rapid geographic expansion while maintaining high performance and reliability


 We're transforming how clean energy solutions are discovered and delivered across Europe through smart backend systems. If you enjoy building scalable systems that directly drive business growth and enable market expansion in a mission-driven environment, this role offers exceptional technical challenges and impact.
   

  

 What you bring to the team
   

  

  

* Strong experience with Java and Spring Boot
* Solid understanding of databases and data modeling (SQL and NoSQL)
* Experience with automated testing (unit tests, integration tests)
* Experience building scalable, distributed systems
* Familiarity with cloud platforms and containerization
* Knowledge of modern development practices (CI/CD, code reviews, agile methodologies)


**Nice to have:**
* Experience with recommendation engines, pricing algorithms, or matching systems
* Database experience (DynamoDB, PostgreSQL)
* Event-driven architectures (Kafka, message queues)
* Cloud DevOps (Docker, Kubernetes, AWS/GCP)
* gRPC and Protobuf
* Infrastructure as Code (Terraform)
* Experience at fast-growing companies expanding into new markets


 Please note:
   

  

 As summer is a time when many of our team members are on vacation, our recruitment process will be slower than usual. We may not be able to review applications and start interviewing until early August, once everyone is back.
   

  

 Thank you for your patience and understanding. We truly appreciate your interest in joining us, and we look forward to connecting with you soon!
   

  

 What is in it for you?
   

  

**Impact & Growth**
* Build systems that directly drive Aira's expansion across Europe and enable market teams
* Work on challenging technical problems including recommendation engines and pricing optimization
* Develop expertise in clean energy markets while contributing to meaningful climate action
* Build scalable infrastructure that supports rapid business growth and product diversification


**Team & Culture**
* Collaborate with talented, mission-driven teams across multiple disciplines and international markets
* Work in an agile, fast-paced environment with modern engineering practices
* Enjoy mentorship opportunities and career development in a growing engineering organization


**Work Environment**
* Hybrid work model with flexibility to balance office and remote work
* Brand-new office at Norra Stationsgatan 93 in Stockholm, conveniently located near Sankt Eriksplan and Odenplan stations
* Competitive compensation and benefits package


 At Aira, we champion the next-generation energy as well as diversity and inclusion. We firmly believe that a diverse workforce fosters innovation and creativity, enhancing our ability to serve customers and communities effectively. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives to join our team. Our commitment is to uphold equality and inclusivity, fostering a collaborative environment where everyone can thrive and contribute to a better future for our people and the planet.
